text: Wow, best dang burger!!! Get the beast, omergerd!!! This is the pot of gold at the end of a dark and contaminated rainbow.  After a long night of being humped and grinded on by degenerate girls full of plastic and daddy issues, this was my nirvana.  It tasted better than the silicon titty that was in my mouth the night before. I only wish it were in Dallas.

So the first time i eat here i got just a cheese burger as i normally  dont care for these "designer burgers" and the bill came to 19.00 for a burger and taters ,  drink
Which they said the tater where famous lol tasted like macain frozen  tater to me. The cheese burger was meh so i said I would never go back for a 20 dollar burger that was meh. Then a friend at work told me to try the thanksgiving day burger. A well seasoned turkey sandwiched between STUFFING and MASHED SWEET PATATOES AND CRANBERRY JELLY  amazing also again almost 20 bucks but worth every bite . But due to price of a regular  cheese burger  i will only come back for the "Thanksgiving day"  if you are going to eat here you better have deep pockets like a movie star

Had the Thanksgiving turkey burger. Burger didn't taste fresh. In fact, the burger came out in record time which further makes me believe it wasn't fresh. There was very little sauce and stuffing in the burger. The sweet potato tots weren't cooked thoroughly either. In conclusion, there are better options in the city for the price point that Wahlburgers is in.

Had to try Wahlburgers in town since I had seen the show many times. However the burgers are overpriced for the size and without any sides being included. The burger tasted fine, nothing extraordinary, and lacked any reason to come back. The service was subpar hostess was very nice but our waitress was not friendly nor attentive. The manager that was featured on the show, never asked us how our meal was as she was on her phone for a majority of our visit. I would not recommend visiting, just take a picture outside.

Short and sweet. Burgers were alright, beer selection was good. Sweet potato tots were meh. Quite pricey for what it is. I'd take a Big Smoke or Burgers Priest over this any day. Glad to have tried it once.
Good food. Burger and sloppy Joes were very tasty. Food came out quickly. Only giving a 3 star review because of the service. Servers did not smile, not friendly. Took away from the experience.

Our waitress was awesome. We are having a bad day and getting held in Canada over night because of terrible porter airlines, thank goodness that we found this place and had an awesome waitress that explained a lot out the restaurant and about the history of it. She was great. And the food was great, fast and reasonable prices. Thank you.

The burgers were good. The service and facilities, not so much. Not even restrooms for paying customers. They send you outside to a public restroom. SMDH. Our waitress barely did her job. I did like the fact that they take your cell number and text you when your table is ready. So overall I'm on the fence, good food, poor service.
Extremely over priced.  The burgers were ok.  The fries over cooked and soaked in salt.  Made a 30 minute walk in 100 degree heat to be sad by their food.

I live very close to Wahlburgers and my review is based on going (1) when they first opened and it was really busy (2) recently on a Saturday to give it a second try. Both times, I was not super impressed with their burgers. 

Pros: 
- The staff is very nice and always friendly
- Tater Tots are not bad but you can always buy your own bag of McCains
- The services is relatively quick (you can be in and out in an hour)

Cons
- The burgers are very greasy (I know, burgers are not suppose to be super healthy, but doesn't mean the buns are gleaming with grease) 
- The burgers are put together very haphazardly. I had the original burger and turkey thanksgiving burger. Both times, I need a billion napkins, which they graciously give, to clean up the sauce that is oozing out the burger. I get the need to have sauce on a burger, but not to the point where it is coming out from all sides of the bun and making your bun soggy. 
- The burgers just don't match up to some of the great burger joints in Toronto like Burger Priests, Parts and Labour or even franchises like Milestones or Jack Astors. 
- The wait times to get a spot. I got it when they first opened, but as I seen in the reviews below, no matter what time or day, even if the restaurant is not at full capacity, you will have to wait while their staff cleans the tables. It seems they have a very inefficient way of running things, they don't have a bus boy/girl cleaning up the mess. The hostess is often running around spraying tables, cleaning up messes and setting up tables. Often, you see a table where the servers have clearly used as a dumping ground for unclean glasses.  This turns me off, but what really sets a bad taste in my mouth when there are CLEAN TABLES AVAILABLE FOR SEATING, but your servers are slow in setting the table!  So, Mark, why am I waiting to be seated when you have tables for seating?

Overall, Toronto is a mecca for great dining. Wahlburgers just isn't able to compete with the creativity that Toronto Chefs have in concocting interesting burgers/sandwiches that would lure Torontonians to keep coming back to this mediocre burger joint.

Don't get me wrong, Wahlburgers have tasty burgers, but they were costly and miniscule. For that price, I predicted their burgers to be two inches thick and stuffed with cheese. That would be ideal if I didn't go in with high expectations.

Don't bother with breakfast here. Small portions of completely generic breakfast staples are marked up to insane prices. I know we're in an airport, but $18 (including tax/tip) for a two-egg breakfast is madness. At least the service is painfully slow, even when the restaurant is less than 1/4 full...

I don't really write reviews, but my Walburgers Las Vegas dining experience was definitely deserving of some high praise. It was my first time in Vegas and on a whim we decided to check out Walburgers. The food was good and the atmosphere was cool, but the Outstanding thing was the Service. Miguel really made us feel welcomed and he really went above and beyond. Everyone in the food service industry should stop in to Walburgers Vegas and take notes from Miguel. I would definitely come back.

Very tasty burgers. Good service!

We tried the fries, poutine, tater-tots, my personal fav, chicken strips, fish burger and the bbq bacon burger -It's sooo good and has a kick to it!

I thought it was pricy originally, but then tried Burger's Priest, it was as expensive, the burger wasn't as good and the fries were super greasy!

The manger Alex, came by our table to say hello. She was super friendly!
Would go back, it's  friendly place for some comfort food!
Always PACKED, luckily we got to jump into free seats at the bar, good food but a bit overpriced for an average cheeseburger

In love with this place! Prices were good, food was amazing and we were sold when we read "government cheese" on the menu! Plus not having to deal with kids is also a plus. Great place to eat and just have a few drinks and relax!!

This is a solid burger joint when you are craving a classic greasy burger. Stick with the OFD/Our Burgers and skip whatever seasonal or proprietary concoction they're trying to pass off as a burger. Laughable to call it a gourmet burger house as I consider the bymark burger to be barely acceptable and Wahlburger's obviously isn't even remotely in the same league. Hit up Marben or nota bene if you are looking for a real, well-rounded gourmet burger. 

Service - Disinterested and curt counter servers. Take out orders take 15-25 minutes to render (even if you're the only one in line). Shuffle to the side after you order and watch whatever sporting event they are streaming and cheer for the sports ball game. 

Tater tots - hit and miss with their crispiness, often times soggy, laden with grease
Fries - not too greasy, pretty decent, but ask them to go easy on the salt unless you like licking salt blocks and relish next day salt bloat
Onion rings - skip these, comes out a soggy mess 4 out of 5 times

OFD burger - can barely discern the swiss cheese, all their buns are cheap white buns with zero redeeming features, no premium fluffy artisanal sesame studded stuff to be found here. Subsequently they get soggy real fast and falls apart while eating (their housemade tomato jam is super jammy), fat, juicy and greasy patty (8 oz. might look paltry in the box but that thing is a killer), will leave you uncomfortably full afterwards but man those first 2-3 bites are just so darn satisfying
Our burger - just a consistently satisfying burger, again the cheese is barely discernible, the pickles are too thin, the bun is a mushy disgrace but if you are low on iron, this thing will get you right back to where you need to be
BBQ Bacon burger - the jalepeno packs some heat and makes this burger a lot more interesting then it actually is, their choice of bacon doesn't add much to the flavor or texture of the burger, BBQ sauce is awkward and cheap tasting, skip it
Thanksgiving burger - a confused concept but basically tastes exactly as it sounds. Order it if you want a leaner cut of meat (the stuffing is quite good quite) but be prepared to feel strangely empty as you eat this grey-ish and sullen-looking patty and ask yourself how someone's tastebuds could be so immature and misguided that they would be compelled to tack this on as a "Wahlfave"
$60 for a meal we could have got at 5 Guys for under $20! Nuff said. Food was nothing short of unspectacular. Service was good.

Order:

  - Double Decker (Cheese and Lettuce)
  - Yukon Gold Fries

Price:

I found this to be quite an expensive meal given the portion for the meal I purchased.  The Yukon Gold Fries I felt were a fair deal however the burger seemed to small to be worth the $10.95 price tag (and that's without bacon).

Size:

I found the size of the Yukon Gold Fries were satisfying however the burger was much too small for my liking.  Everyone has their preferences but if you have a similar appetite, this burger will leave you feeling hungry once finished as it did for me.

Quality:

The quality is something to boast about and somewhat over compensates for the stiff price.  The burger was very juice and you could taste the freshness of the patties based solely on the fact that it melts in your mouth as you chew down. The fries had a certain "zing" to it that I found delicious compared to your typical fast food restaurant.

Overall:

I would most likely return to this restaurant.  Despite the steep prices, the burger was actually presented well and the taste complimented it nicely.  Perhaps next time for a bigger burger to satisfy my large appetite!
Not a place I'll ever dine at again. I think Hardy's has better cheese burgers then this place and I don't like Hardy's.

Let's start off with the service, junior went above and beyond when we showed up late for some drinks and appetizers. Fernanda hooked us up with an adult milkshake. The food was amazing didn't expect it to be that good, we had to go there twice in one day!!!  Over all great place for food, drinks, and experience.

Didnt like how they cooked the turkey burger it made me sick after but the restaurant is clean and staff is very nice. Wouldnt come back to try this one but would try other walburgers like the one in Boston MA there food is great they're.

There is absolutely no value in eating here.  Where ever they can they cut corners and charge too much.
Lets start with the fries for $3.50 you would expect a full container but instead they serve you a half full cup of fries.  Potatoes are the cheapest thing you can serve...why do they feel it necessary to skimp so much?
Next the burger.  Decent size but not large by any ones standards.  Really no flavour to it.  I had bacon and cheese on mine and I think there was only once piece of bacon and not a lot of cheese.  For some reason they butter the bun so it is unnecessarily greasy which is too bad because its actually a decent bun.  I spend about $20 on a burger, fries and fountain drink and left disappointed with the food.  If you are going to charge $10 for a burger you better make it a lot better than that.
In general the place is clean and there are lots of places to seat.
I will not go again.
The bbq bacon burger was great but the onion rings not great that is taste and presentation. I was given a replacement order of sweet potato tots which I really enjoyed.

An update to my previous negative review....management of Walburgers invited us back and this time our experience was extremely positive. Josh, our friendly waiter, was terrific and took our drink order immediately and our food order was correct, good, and hot. Josh really was hussling and checked back on a regular basis despite the crowd. Clearly changes have been made within a couple of months to improve their business, service, and staff. The patio is really nice; recommend going there and sitting outside; consider trying the Jenn's chicken sandwich. Thank you Walburgers!

Burgers are awesome! Highly recommended! They are pricy but this is no fast food burger. Service was a bit slow but was still worth coming to for a great and tasty burger. Suggest not to get the onion rings, which are really onion straws. Stick with the fries.

Wahlburgers is great ! Awesome location filled with very friendly staff , Our server Lewis was very attentive to our needs and made sure our orders were perfect . I recommend the beast excellent tasting burger ! 

Thank you Las Vegas
This place is so good. Great burgers and food for a great price. Definitely worth the hype!

Mom's sloppy joe was good but barely any sloppy joe on it. Slight amount of meat and mostly covered with onion straws. Also, the Wahl sauce is just like every other "special sauce" eg thousand island. (In and Out, MCD's).

Found a couple seats at the bar as soon as my friend and I walked up around 8pm on a Saturday. The bar staff was friendly and attentive, and the food was delicious. I got 'The Our Burger' cooked medium and tots. I will definitely be back to try the rest of the menu!

Terrible.

Small portions.  
Cold food.
Overcooked meat.  

I don't get this place at all.  I have no idea what theme they are going for.

Waste of time.  Lots of hype.  I love a good over priced burger.  And I got a dried over priced burger.   My burger had a fried egg on it.   Omg.  The egg was dry.  I sent it back.  Still dry.  They are not that good.  My daughter  ordered a hotdog.  She needed to kill it in ketchup to eat it.  The fries are really good the fries get a 4 star the restaurant  gets a 2.  You are better off ordering the takeout and eating upstairs.
Didn't expect much but service was great and Jen's sandwich was a huge chicken burger that went down really well!!

On our way to the Blue Jays game my friend Bobby and I decided we would make my wife jealous and hit up Wahlburgers. It was a great experience that I would recommend to anyone.

They have a nice little restaurant on Blue Jays Way near the Rogers Center. It has a nice design with an eat in area in the front and take out at the back near the kitchens. They also have a small balcony area for take out people to eat if there is room. We didn't want to wait for a table so we headed to the back for takeout.

I ordered the Double Decker and Fries while Bobby had the OFD (Originally from Dorcester) and some Tater Tots. We both really enjoyed our food. Everything was really fresh and tasted great. Next time I think I will get the triple because I was still a little hungry but that's my fault for not getting enough.

We were lucky enough to score a table upstairs to eat so we hung out, ate and watched the Jays fans make their way to the game. I will definitly be eating here next time I go to a game.

I like the TV show; so I was willing to check the place out. This place is so over priced for a McDonald's burger. The bathrooms smelt and were dirty. The upstairs garbage was full and the employees just kept walking by it. Also, when I was walking up the stairs to find a restroom I was cut off by two employees. The only good thing about this place was my server who I gave an extra $20 to and she brought it back. That's the only reason I'm giving it a 2 star not a 1.

I am a huge fan of the show and of the family.
But not a fan of the overpricing. The shoestring onion rings were so salty they weren't even edible. 
The bun was good but nothing else was good enough for the prices or the wait. Also the sweet tots were under cooked. 
Very disappointing cause I wanted to LOVE it.  :(

Still a fan, just not one of the restaurant.

A regular burger is simple, yet difficult to get right. I love their 'Our' burger - amazing bun and overall great taste. I went there almost every day during my trip! I've been on a quest since then to find an equal/better burger, but I just haven't found it, yet. They really need to open up more than one location in Canada.
This is a great place, expect to pay strip prices.. but great burger, great staff and great atmosphere!
Long wait time and so-so food. Would not recommend. Was expecting much better. Oh well, gave it a try.

Ive never had so much fun in my life! We stopped by wahlburgers last night and got drinks from the bar. Brittany and jones were absolutley amazing. The music was bumpin the vibe was fun we danced and had such a great time. The most down to earth people weve met in vegas so far. We have a few days left and plan on going back to see them for more drinks for my bachlorette party. Thanks yall for showing us a good time!

I only had a problem with the price. 

Service was good, Aria was our bartender and she was verrry pleasent and great. Food tasted good but we believe it was a little too expensive for what you get. My burger was $11 and it was about the size of a Whopper Jr. It is a la carte so you still have to buy a side of fries.

Waited almost an hour for a burger not worth the wait. I ordered "The Melt" it's a grilled cheese with a meat patty in the middle. I've never had a grilled cheese that I didn't love and unfortunately I only remember how bad it was. It was very dry!!

We went to Wahlburgers for dinner.  They asked how we wanted the burgers cooked and we said medium (which they also recommended).  They burgers came out well done!  The sweet Potato Tots were good.  Nothing special about this place.
I love coming here after work on the strip! Courtney, the bartender, is super cool and always friendly! Great people. Great food. Two thumbs up.

We started by waiting 30-40 mins to be seated, not bad. Then, after we were seated, we waited another 20 minutes to be able to flag down a server. She said that because we ordered drinks from the bar, they assumed we were served (which of course, has never happened at any other establishment we have been to). After i was able to flag someone down, she said it would be another hour before we even saw our food. So we left. Never even got to try the food. Sad, because the chain in the Northeast is not bad.

Me and my husband came to whalburgers
After the autoshow and we were starving. The service was let's say...mediocre and the wait for take out was verrrry long (maybe because of hunger?) we ordered two double deckers,two fries,onion rings, Alma's Mac and one drink as they don't do combos. Well that all came to.....$44.52! Very expensive, however we really enjoyed the burgers. the fries were ok and the onion straws or strings? Well those are ok too. It's definitely not worth going out of your way for but still is pretty good!

Tried Wahlburgers today for the first time. Overall I think it was great. Tasty food, good atmosphere, prices are what I'd expect....mostly (see my comments on drink prices below). 

I ordered the Our Burger, Sweet Potato Tots, and Iced Tea. Total was $17 something.  Other reviewers have complained about the automatic 18% gratuity which did make me pause. But you can skip that and head to the back take out counter and order from there where no gratuity is added. They have a decent sized section of tables near the counter reserved for people who order from take out (same food menu).  So basically if you don't want table service just head to the back and you should have no problem grabbing a table after getting your food (no automatic gratuity). 

The burger was a bit smaller than other burger places (I ordered the single Our Burger not the double or triple) but with that and the sweet potato tots it was definitely a full meal. Burger was very tasty. Comes with lettuce, tomato, pickles, onion, cheese, and their special wahlsauce. I'd certainly order that again. You can add additional toppings for extra cost (think caramelized onions, sautéed mushrooms, crispy bacon, white cheddar, blue cheese, onion rings, avocado). 

Sweet potato tots were good.....probably a good complement to their Thanksgiving Burger.  The side order was quite large. 

My friend ordered the BBQ Bacon Burger with Tater Tots and Alma's Macaroni. She loved the meal.....raved about the burger! I tasted the macaroni salad and can say it was quite good...fresh tasting. 

On my next trip I plan to try the Wahlbrewski (locally brewed IPA.... I've read it's a special brew from Mill Street). It goes for $7 /pint. Oddly their bottled beers seem over priced (bottle of Corona for $8?) I can only assume they're strategically priced to push the Wahlbrewski....

For a soft opening their staff was well prepared. Word is official grand opening is Nov 15 which may include an actual Wahlberg brother or two. 

I'll definitely return to try more of the burger menu.

For a burger joint, I would expect the burger to be the highlight of the meal. However the Bbq bacon burger was served with a cold and soggy bun. Beef patty was dry. Burger was a bit overpriced $12. Instead the highlight of my meal was the sweet potato tater tots that were very good, surprisingly. Service was good.

I went their with my girlfriend and we totally enjoyed the food.  The burgers are a little bit on the spendy side but they had a great flavor and the tots were good.  I'd say in the grand scheme of the burger world, they are better than 5 guys but still don't de-throne In-n-Out.
Food was amazing and the prices were great however our waiter, Ross, blew us away. The best service we've had in a long time!

As a local, I drove down and parked in the Paris parking deck. I was pleasantly surprised to find the restaurant close to the Bally's casino just beside the Starbucks in the Grand Bazzaar shops. I had driven past before on Las Vegas Blvd, however, what I saw was their kiosk out front. We were greeted immediately by a super friendly host who directed us to the bar for quick seating. (Secret for anyone reading, I always sit at the bar lol) Our bartenders, Michaela and Basil were also friendly and took our order right away. We ordered the Our burger, the bbq bacon burger and tator tots. We also had a strawberry mule and a pint of Guinness. Everything we had was amazing. Our drinks were prompt, our food came out quickly and the service was superb. The bar manager, Paul, stopped by to check on us and really made us feel at home. I loved the way the fresh jalapeños gave the bbq bacon burger a zing. Our tator tots were perfectly crisp and the our burger I should have taken a picture of because I would love to try and recreate that at home. The atmosphere was electric. Great buzz about the place. Constant traffic of people in and out. This is a great addition to the area. Really raises the bar for Bally's and the Grand Bazaar shops. We will certainly be back. There are so many items I want to try. Beyond the great food and service, I see some very exciting shakes and cocktails that I look forward to giving a shot on my next visit. Check this place out for sure.

Came here on a Sunday evening with my family with 2 small kiddies. The space easily accommodated us and our stroller. Ambience and staff were easy going.

We ordered the "our burger", the Dorchester, sweet tots and onion rings. We loved the "our burger" and ended up ordering another round of the our burger. (Definitely could easily eat 2 burgers). The first "our burger" was cooked medium to medium well on some areas, which OK considering it was stated on the menu that, that's how it's cooked. However I would of liked it if it were either consistently medium or consistently medium well... Not just different areas! Also the onion rings (as stated on the menu)... Umm I expected rings not shreds of deep fried onion. Wasn't sure how to eat it... Went from eating few shreds of a time by hand to using a fork, which wasn't very effective. Beware of the "onion rings". The sweet tots were ok. Overall, the "our burger" stood out the most.

It took quite a longer time than the usual fast paced burger joints to get our burgers served. However the staff were friendly. 

It's a good place to hang with friends and watch a game and good enough to bring your family.

Came here for a late lunch today.  I ordered the grilled cheese sandwich with bacon and side of tater tots.  My husband had the turkey burger.  Excellent food!  The grilled cheese was loaded with bacon!  And my husband couldn't believe how good the turkey burger was!  Will definitely be back to try other items on the menu!

Got the mac-n-cheese and added pulled pork. Mac was bland and al dente and came in the size of a small cup. Pulled pork was tasty but came in the size of a salsa container from a mexican restaurant. Cost $13.

Great service, checked in and the wait was 25 mins. The app they use let us know how many parties in front of us and how much time left. Our waitress was nice and courteous. My BBQ bacon burger was great and loved the tater tots! I would recommend to anyone in Vegas!
The quality was the worst, food was cold and you pay a premium price because it's on the strip. Go to 5 guys and get your money's worth.

Breakfast is NOT good at all. Sausage and tots were very oily and of a cheap quality. Eggs did not came as we ordered. Coffee was $4 and it was very weak. On the bright side, service was fast and friendly. I will came back to try the burger one of these days.

I was disappointed with this burgers what with all the fan fare from the related television program. The plating was well done. The restaurant looked great but the burgers didn't have a memorable taste, the fries were good however.

First time eating here, and it might be because of the airport, but it wasn't all that I expected it to be.
I got the melt and a side of mac salad. The taste of the burger was great, amazing flavor, but the bread was super greasy. Then the mac salad was dry and flavorless. Even the coke they brought me tasted bad!
Guess you can't believe everything you see on TV.

I wish that I could give it 5 stars just because Fernanda and Amanda were adorable and gave us such great service. I ordered a chicken salad and my husband order the classic house burger. Even though our food was taking a very long time (they weren't very busy but the girls explained that they had only been open a short time and were trying their best). We didn't mind the wait because we were having so much fun with the girls. I eventually received my salad and our sides (which were not hot, though Amanda replaced them right away) but my husband still did not have his cheeseburger. The girls assured us it would be out right away. After 10 minutes and those poor girls getting yelled at by the people behind the counter, the cheeseburger arrived. When it arrived it was a complete mess and looked like it had been in a martini shaker and poured on a plate. The girls apologized profusely and kindly took 20 percent off of our meal for our trouble. The salad and cheeseburger were actually tasty, but the whole experience with the food made us not want to return unless it was for drinks only with the very friendly wait staff the restaurant seemed to have. We will be traveling the states this month and are hoping to try another Wahlburgers that is maybe more seasoned when it comes to the food.

I had to go to Wahlburgers when I arrived in Vegas. The location was cool and it was crowded but no wait. I ordered Donnie's favorite, The BBQ bacon using a turkey patty and it was delicious. Everything I excepted. I'll be back in 2 months when I go back to Vegas.
I love Wahlburgers delicious tasting burgers. I recommend the Double Decker with sweet potato tots. Love you Patty you rock!!

Finally tried Markey Marks place 

Burgers are okay, nothing special.  However, Mac and Cheese with smoked bacon and thin crispy onion rings are phenomenal.  I'd come back just for the sides

On vacation from the east coast and happened to stumble in here.  My family and I were thrilled when we did. We love the show and had high expectations.  I had the Thanksgiving day sandwich, apparently it's Marky Marks favorite.  The burger was excellent and everything I wanted it to be!Our waiter Ross was very attentive, fast to bring us everything, and great with suggestions.  The best service I received on my entire vacation.  I highly recommend wahlburgers and ask for Ross!
I'm so glad I found this place. It's my new go to for drinks and great food. Victor was my bartender. He was on top of it. Best service I've had in Vegas by far!!!!
WORST SERVICE EVER! Not even a decent restroom. Waitresses aren't charismatic and the whole staff is always looking bad. High prices, low service, ugly food.

I went for lunch and love burgers on the grill taste, so I ordered a cheese burger with onion rings. The service was slow had to several times ask who was waiter  but it was busy , then waiter showed up friendly and took our order. Our order arrived and I took a bite and it was like biting into a crisco lard sandwich. I like some grease on my burger like the next guy but the grease was just to much. Then on to the onion rings, if that's what you want to call them,  they are more like broken tree branches fried in oil. The waiter brought the check and noticed I didn't eat the food and offered to talk to the manager, who didn't charge me, and that's what the rating is for as they were great about it but the chef wasted the other 3 part of my star rating.
Finally got to try this place out. Excellent burgers! Onion rings were great too! Great service and atmosphere.

Stopped by for a quick lunch. Had a club house turkey burger. It was pretty decent. Good enough for a quick lunch. Nice sporty vibe. The waiter was very accommodating too. Finished my food before taking a photo.

I was walking the strip and was hungry so decided to stop at Wahlburgers to have a m and also a drink so sat at the bar. Rodrigo is the bartender who greeted me and was amazing the entire time. Great customer service. I ordered the Portobello sandwich and it was delicious. Will stop by again
Ok but Overrated.  I've had much better burgers before.  Solid but nothing memorable.   Pretty bland overall.

Been here for over an hour, still don't have food. We asked to order and frankly literally waved our hands for a while before we were even served.  A table that came in after we ordered just received their food. We asked about it and we were told our order likely never processed. Would have been nice to know that when they found out...offering us 25% discount.  Not enough for the horrible service.  Pains me to say this as I love this place and their food but this isn't acceptable.

So glad this place opened up. I've stopped to get the triple deck burger here both times I've come to Vegas in the past year. This past time it was super crowded, but we were able to find seats at the bar. Courtney took care of us. She was super attentive but not overbearing. Both the food and service was 5 star
Wahlburgers is fine for a fast food burger; but it's nothing special. If you're really in search of an amazing burger, however, there are infinitely better places to go in the city.

Total morons work at this place! Hostesses and the one male host are terrible. They have no clue what they are doing and haven't been trained properly. I wanted to try this place but because of their rudeness  left!

Friendly staff, disappointing food. Very greasy onion shredded "rings". Wife had Jenn's chicken sandwich which she did not like. I had the BFD which was not very good as well. Won't be returning to this restaurant.

This place has a lively atmosphere with friendly staff/quick service, and good food... it's pricey for such a small burger (& no fries incld.), however. It's the sort of place people generally go for the experience (celeb/t.v. show connection...), in my opinion, and ours was enjoyable.

Loud, noisy inside.  Burgers delivered to wrong table, took way too long, and were cold!  They were also missing the bacon we asked for.. geez.  Above all else they were meh even if they arrived on time and warm.  On plus side wait staff was friendly and apoligetic.  Skip the hype, go elsewhere

I looked up wahlburgers on yelp to see if they do takeout orders, and of course it said yes. So i called to confirm and yes again. We wanted takeout to take back to our room at Ballys cause it was too hot out. 
Once we got got there i informed the employee that we wanted to order takeout and he came back very rude and said we dont take out i explained to him that i had just called and they confirmed that they do. 
We were very unhappy about this cause we are huge fans of the show and did not get treated well. 
I even DM the Wahlbergs on instagram about this.
Awesome! I had the BBQ bacon burger and fries. The quality of the food didn't suffer at all from being an airport restaurant.
Good burger. Cold fries. Slow service.  Had to go because Mark Wahlburg!  Yea no bathrooms inside, no appetizers.  Not bad prices though for the strip.

LOVED IT!!! At around 6pm on Saturday night the wait was only about 20 minutes. They get your phone number and text you when your table is ready. My husband & I both had the Our Burger and my sister had Dads Basic Burgers all of which were cooked perfectly! I strongly recommend the Mac N' Cheese with Smoked Bacon. SO GOOD!! Our server (I wish I could remember his name) was great. 3 burgers, 2 sides of fries, 1 side of tots and the mac n cheese all for about $60. Not too bad. I'm a local so I will definitely be back!!

I was so excited that they opened a walburger in Vegas I had to try their burger my babe wanted to go to Bobby fay I said no let go to walburger the place was nice music not to loud the food omg the burger I was not impressed the Mac and cheese was watery and the fries cold I wish I went to Bobby flay ......

Watch out, IN and OUT!! These burgers are AH-mazing! We stopped in while walking the strip in Vegas and were so pleasantly surprised! Everyone from the host at the door, to our server were very friendly and concerned that we were getting everything we needed. Clean, clean, clean! It was VERY busy during lunch time, but our wait was less that 15 minutes. We both got the classic double and added our own little twists (jalapenos/bacon). Our server was Lauren and was on point! Very pretty with a beautiful smile.  We came back the same afternoon, after the ferris wheel for milkshakes. We were lucky enough to get Lauren again. We ordered milkshakes and a rootbeer float. We also decided to splurge and split a 'Fluffanuttah' grilled sandwich (peanutbutter, bananas, nutella, fluff, grilled) YUM!  All of the prices are comparable to the strip. We were shocked at how great the meat was! The manager even came over to speak with us about our experience. Make it a point to stop in here. You won't be disappointed! Ask for Lauren.
Awesome burgers, great service and fun atmosphere. Had the OFD and loved it.  Onion strings were so yummy.  This will be a stop for me every time I am in Vegas.  Wish you would open one in Seattle.

Disappointed!!!  It's a burger place and the burgers were just not good.  I believe it is related to poor cooking rather than poor quality.  Burger patty could've been used as a hockey puck.  Adult frappes were great.  Tater tots were just what you would expect.  Onion strings were not good.  The service here was exceptional.  Our server did a great job and was very attentive.  My fiancé says "I love you Donnie"

Food was good but for the price u pay compared to portion size and quality of service, it's not worth it. I was excited about trying it but I probably won't go back unless someone I know wanted to go for the novelty of it all.
Fair service,burgers are raw,management unprofessional, they tried to charge me for burgers I did not eat!!!! Corporate never responded to my e mail!!!Bad Business!!!!

So disappointed.  Have been waiting to try this place for a long time.  I watch the show and I love the Wallburg family.  However the service was terrible.  I waited for 45 min for a burger and fries.  When it came my fries were cold and my burger was dripping grease. 
No one checked on me about my meal. In fact they left my bill/ chequer when I ordered.

Burgers were dry, not juicy at all.  Love tater tots, so no complaint there.  Their "Onion Rings" are not onion rings at all but onion straws that you see garished often on steaks so definitely not I was expecting and not good as a side.  Agree with people commenting on the decor, it's definitely a weird fusion of sit down and fast food.  Bright white and green decor screams freshii, not a gourmet burger joint.  Bar looks good, lots of selection but again, fits in weirdly with the rest of the decor.

Came here with my hubby and some friends, wanted to try it out since we are such huge mark Wahlburg fans. My burger, the our burger was very dry, but the sauce was good. I ordered the mud pie but it was grey not chocolate in color and did not taste like chocolate at all although clearly on their tvs in the restaurant it is chocolate colored. Def not worth 15$. 1 star for the sauce and 1 star for tater tots. Burger priest is much better than this place.

After waiting for 25 minutes,  we walked out.  The waitress walked by is at least 10 times and never acknowledged that we were there.  Told the host and he reminded her she had another table and still did not wait on us.  Went to Johnny Rockets and had Awesome burgers, Awesome service and much cheaper!!!

Underwhelming. Portions small. Burgers lackluster. Atmosphere touristy. Just build the price of fries into the meal cost. Nobody wants to pay $12 for a sub-par burger and then have to pitch an extra $3.00 for a meager side of fries.

Was curious to see what the fuss was about. Will not be going back.

If you are from the Boston area or know anything about the Bostonian favorite foods - you need to try this place. We got a table in 15 minutes! Pretty good for New Years weekend in Vegas. Eric was an awesome server and suggested his favorites menu option and pointed out Donnie's and Mark's favorites. You'll feel like part of the Wahlberg family. The Walh-sauce was awesome one the tarot tots. Enjoy!!

This is not easy because I wanted to like this restaurant. I like their show, and thought their food would be outstanding.  Unfortunately, I was left underwhelmed.

First of all, it was 45 min to be seated, then another 10 min to get our order taken, and another 25 min to get our food. All totaled, 80 min before I took my first bite.

As for the food, we ordered the Thanksgiving Sandwich, "Our Burger", and Onion Strings.  The Thanksgiving was very dry, and I'm sure this was due to the ground turkey patty.  Not even the cranberry sauce inside helped with how dry it was.  "Our Burger" wasn't bad, but it tasted like something anyone could make at home.  At nearly $12, it should be more exceptional.  The Onion Strings were undercooked.  Lastly, though minor, there was no ice in my soda.  I didn't really get a chance to ask the young man as he seemed very rushed and busy.  

In the end, I can now say I tried Wahlburgers.  I will only go back if I am ever in Boston, as I would like to try the food at the original restaurant.  As for the Las Vegas location, there are way too many other choices I'd make before I dined there again.

My boyfriend and I were excited to check out Wahlburgers hoping to find another great burger joint near home.  We ordered the bbq bacon burger and the double decker w/bacon  along with 2 sides, tater tots & onion rings for take out. We anticipated the wait, took 30 minutes, and was hopefull it would have been worth it. When we brought the food home we were disappointed to find out our order was wrong....no bacon on the double decker. The burgers were decent but definately had better but the sides were good.  I'm not sure if i would go back to wait 30 minutes and to have them screw up my order.   Btw, don't drive there....took 25 min to find parking.

We were excited to try out this place. We were seated pretty quickly with prompt service. My husband ordered a burger and I ordered the mushroom sandwich. I have to say my sandwich was overly oily and it over powered any other taste. My husband enjoyed his burger and it wasn't nearly as oily as mine. When you order make sure to say light oil.

Best burger in Toronto? Indeed 1 of the best for sure. Excellent quality and amazing taste. Highly recommended! We ordered the "Our Burger" with sweet potato tots and golden tots. The service was great and the atmosphere was very welcoming. The food was incredibly delicious. I thoroughly enjoyed everything. I recommend this place for all burger lovers.

After all the hype about this restaurant and based on its location in the SOHO Hotel one would expect this burger joint would be something exciting to experience, well it is not! Instead this place was one of the most disappointing places I have ordered food from. We placed a phone in order and went to pick it up for 4 adults and two children. The person who picked it up asked if the staff could double check the order  to make sure the order was complete. Well many things were missing. This was one person returning to our room with many bags. They could packed the numerous bags in one larger one making it easier to carry but they did not. They missed out on all the condiments and I mean all. Not even a napkin was offered. On the menu it states all their burgers are topped with dill pickles, cheese, lettuce, tomato and onion. Well ours came with none of these things. The meat was too salty. The food was given to us cold. The tater tots are pictured with dipping sauces which were not offered. There were no lids on the tater tots allowing them to get cold quickly on the walk from the restaurant through the hotel back to our room. The grilled cheese sandwiches ordered came as one grilled cheese. We had two kids to feed. The only thing decent was the Macaroni salad.
When you are paying $10.00 for a hamburger or more you expect more than your average burger. We were all very disappointed in the food and service. We will not be returning to this place again.

Many options in Las Vegas for celebrity restaurants and went with Wahlbergers because I like thier show; however does not translate to a great restaurant. The servers were a little rushed and not friendly. Got the BBQ burger and came with no BBQ, when I tracked down a different server she basically asked what I wanted, like who cared... Food was ok, over priced for burgers and everyone agreed everything was just ok!

I went to Wahlburger's on a Friday during what I believe would be dinner rush time and received fabulous service. The hostess was welcoming and the bartender (who was my server) was very accommodating and friendly. The "our burger" was hands down one of the best burgers I have had! 
This place is a must try!!!!

Meh, this place is just okay. Honestly I did enjoy their burgers and their fries and I'm a huge burger fry guy but for the price that you're has to pay there really isn't much to this place it's basically a McDonald's with Mark Wahlberg photos hanging over the walls. There's also a dining room area where you can have a waiter serve you these McDonald's like burgers. Which to be honest just seems really weird. 
I'm not sure if while burgers is a burger joint or a restaurant it has fast food quality food and fast food atmosphere with waiters, a bar, and price from a expensive restaurant.
The Thanksgiving burgers pretty good and deafly worth a try but I wouldn't think to go here on my own accord. Though somebody else were to mention going here I would have a problem with it.

My boyfriend has been wanting to eat a Wahlburger since the premiere of their show, he's a big fan of the Wahlburgs so of coarse we came out to vegas for his birthday and saw their beautiful building piercing on the strip and had to go! We're from the Los Angeles area and are aware there is one opening up on sunset and are really looking forward to dining there as well. But Las Vegas location set the bar high. Great service, we absolutely loved our waiter, the burger fries and onion rings were beyond delicious. Everything cooked perfectly. Awesome place we are looking forward to coming back

The burger was good but small, price for the burger seems to high since you can get a bigger burger in other good joints for a similar price. The house sauce and the homemade ketchup didn't provide much difference in flavor. The restaurant had a good atmosphere.

I was so excited to try a Wahlburgers.  So disappointed :).  Waited a while for the server to come to our table.  Asked question about the menu and she just shrugged her shoulders and pointed to the menu. Food turned cold on us and server never came back to ask if we needed anything.

All I wanted to do was enjoy a beer and some apps with 3 friends on the patio to enjoy the beautiful Friday night. Nope was told 15-20 minute wait.  Ok I will get a beer at the bar and wait.  Nope, can only go to the bar if there are seats open at the bar. Ok there are 4 seats.  Nope.  Look at the picture, looks like a lot of open seats.

My girlfriend and I went on a Saturday night put our name on the wait list and was told it would be 30 minutes and they would call us when our table is ready. We waited at public Square for 40 minutes before going back to check up on our table. Once we walked in the host claims she called us but we never recieved any type of phone call. We get seated and ordered and it took 45 minutes from when we ordered to receive our food and when our food comes out they definitely only brought out 1 fry. Food was okay our patties came out a little red. Definitely would not be going here again anytime soon.

As I read the heartwarming tale of the Wahlburg's growing up in Dorchester sitting around the table enjoying food, family, love, I snapped back into my reality of eating mediocre food and hemorrhaging $62 for a salad, tots, and two burgers. The market is saturated with burger joints so there are way better options out there.

Visited on 1/15/17 service was good ..burgers were tasty and juicy..the fries unfortunately were over cooked which seems to be the industry standard these days...the reason for the 3 stars comes with the pricing 2 burgers 2 fries 2 cokes and tip should never be $58 even on the Las Vegas strip...there was nothing special about Wahlburgers overall. Sadly this was a 1 and done its pricing simply can not be overlooked

heard about place for a while, was a little anti climatic

the burgers are dinky but good quality. got the turkey burger which was really good. could easily eat 2 of them. 

good to try out for first time but would prefer alot of other burger places. 

price is $$$ for what u get.

The burger was amazing. We were not hungry but really wanted to try one and split one. It was so good we bought a second. The service was slow but it's only its third day open so I am not surprised, they are obviously still learning. The staff was very friendly though. Will definitely come back my next visit to Vegas.

Just ate here with this afternoon at the Soho location.  

PROS:
This is a very good central Downtown Toronto location, can't beat the spot on Blue Jays Way.
Decent service noted considering the typical busy lunch period on a Saturday and especially for a long weekend.  Waited approx. 10 minutes for my order so not bad. 
Main level seating area was fairly clean.  

CONS: 
I tried the OFD burger for myself and can honestly say that I have had much better.  I also understand the higher price for the central downtown / hotel location but this burger was bland (meat had no seasoning at all) and also way to much oil overall, which turned the potential brioche-style bun into a soggy disaster.  The tomato jam was more like regular tomato sauce, quite disappointing.  My friend tried The Melt, also way to much oil and wrong choice of bread used in my opinion (regular white toast), which crumbled apart because of all the wet ingredients - could have been better with a thicker bun. So $30.00 for 2 burgers and one drink, was not worth it at all.  
Decided to sit at the upper level since the main level was quite full, big mistake (should have taken our food to go) because the tables were not wiped down, lots of napkins and garbage on the floor & messy condiment area.........some fast food joints out there do a much better job with the cleanliness and upkeep.  Although the upper level is a more casual seating area, it should not be overlooked.

I'm rating this place 2 stars based on the quality of food vs overall price, and the lack of cleanliness.   There are better burger places in the city that are worth the price.
Decent burger. Fries are ok. Didn't blow me away in Hingham didn't blow me away in CLE. Good location though if looking for something on the way to a game.

Great place to eat with friends and family in Vegas. Visited on a Monday night, pretty crowded but still got a seat quickly. Burgers great, tots awesome, and so was the mac n cheese. All staff helpful and friendly, will eat again next visit to Vegas

I had really high expectations considering burger places are the new rage in the restaurant industry. I had the dad burger which only has the special sauce, pickles, and onions. While my burger was juicy my pickles were missing and there was barely any sauce on my bun. I went with 3 other people who enjoyed their meals, but we were never given silverware or offered refills on our drinks. The fries were super salty and the onion strings needed a dipping sauce. Overall, our meal was just ok. Nothing special about any of it. I was super excited to get the fluffanutta as dessert. To my surprise, it barely had fluff and was soaked in butter. It tasted greasy and smelled like burnt toast. I was highly disappointed with it. Service and food were all mediocre at best.

Went here on Tuesday for dinner, was seated immediately. I would think that when I am paying $13 for a double burger (2, 3 ounce patties) that it would include a side with it. Well I was wrong, you have pay extra if you want fries. I ended up going for the Macaroni & Cheese with bacon, that is an additional $8. The best part was the bacon. The cheese sauce was watery and lacked flavor and left the pasta dry. Cheese is supposed to be creamy and should stick to the pasta. To get the cheese I had to drink it out of the cup. I do not think I will go back, $32 for a burger, macaroni and a beer.

Arrived mid-way through lunch, got a table with some friends. Enjoyed a tasty burger and some sides. The service was great. I enjoyed my sweet potato tater tots and my friends had onion rings. The onion rings are more like something I would put on a burger instead of a side. Tasty food, clean space and great service = excellent lunch.

The fries were nice but the burger patty was small and I had to find it in between the buns. Cute, but not what a carnivore seeks. A quick bite, yes. 

The setup is slightly confusing in that the takeout is in the back of the restaurant. 

Didn't click until I saw all the references to Mark Wahlberg to realize the wordplay with the restaurant name.

The show is great.   The restaurant is a different story.  First of all there is only one way in and out, very awkward because they take your cell phone number to page you when a table is available.  There isn't anywhere to sit while you wait outside and the area outside the restaurant is smoky, noisy and full of drunks.  The food:   Ehh. I've had much better burgers for way less expensive.  It was so loud in the restaurant: music playing outside, music playing inside, drunk idiots yelling and screaming.  I had to yell my order to the waiter.  My family was not able to talk to each other without yelling because it was so loud in the restaurant.  No drink refills or offer to refill.  The burgers were so so.  3 burgers, 3 soft drinks, an order of tater tots and an order of fries.  $65.00.   Sorry Mark, Paul, Donnie and Elma,  love your show, but won't be going back to Wahlburgers again.  Too bad, we were really looking forward to it also.  Bottom line: disappointing, don't waste your time or money eating here.
I thought it was amazing! The service was super fast and the food was so good! I would go there every week if I had a choice!

Outstanding food. Went in because of the name and tv show trying to temper expectations. My expectations were blown away, food, drinks, and sides were amazing. Mac n cheese with bacon was the perfect side to the bbq burger which was cooked to perfection. If you have a waiter named Rob, listen to his suggestions. He won't steer you wrong and he was a blast to have as a waiter. Joked around with me and my family and made the whole experience that much better.
It was amazing little soggy but  really good  service ok gave me free stickers Amazing

Ordered the BBQ burger with fries. Tom the burger to be just okay nothing special. They have plenty of seating and the environment was good. However not terribly excited about going back. If I do go back it will be to try a different burger.
Ran out of corona before the cavs final and service was so slow. Broooo the this place is whack af

I decided it was time to get a hot decent meal after flying in to Toronto from Budapest, which was about 9 hour flight. I came across Wahlburgers located near terminal 67 while waiting for my connecting flight to Los Angeles. I chose the Crispy Haddock sandwich for $9.95 with regular fries for $3.95. I waited about 20 minutes to get my order. The fries were cold and not seasoned. The sandwich buns were also cold and saggy. The tartar sauce did not even taste like tartar sauce. The fried fish was a large portion and it was not crispy at all. The fish was under seasoned and it smelled very fishy. This was my first and last time to visit this franchise burger place.
Burger Patties were way smaller than the bun. Sweet Potato Tots were half of the cup. The Location by the Stadium is way better!!

Wahlburgers was alright, but the menu was a bit of a mess. They have burgers at 8 ounces and burgers at 1/3 of a pound. Why on earth can't they stick to one measurement unit? Worse than that, their 1/3 lb burger actually comes in two different patty sizes at two different price points. It's listed on the menu as a 1/3 lb and suddenly you get a choice of how big it is. What? I was so confused by the waitress I just pointed at the menu. 

And it's creepy that they call American cheese, "government" cheese. Calling it government cheese makes it sound like it's going to be full of mold, maybe old and rancid, and kind of disgusting. Like it's been stuck in some government warehouse since the 1950s.

Burger was okay, nothing fantastic. Onion rings however, we're out of this world. Thin and lightly battered, with sea salt. Absolutely delicious.

With so many burger places to choose from, I doubt I'll be back. I'm not buying into the brand - I don't buy into any burger brand. I just want good burgers.

Had one of the best burgers in my life at this place. 8oz beef bacon burger sauteed with mushrooms was perfect right till the last bite. I had to slow down when I realized I only had 2-3 bites left and remind myself to savour it haha. The poutine was also a good side and perfect size.

Was delicious, we each got a different burger and no complaints.  Service was awesome. We even switched servers in the middle of our meal and the service remained awesome!!  Food was served hot, beer was cold, what more can you ask for.
Wahlburgers are not tasty at all, especially at the price they are offering. You're overpaying for that quality of burgers.
Loved this place.  Burger was delish!   What a great staff!  Made you feel so welcome; patiently answered my questions; appreciate that!!!

I had wahlburgers today and to be honest, it was dam good. Wait was 15 minutes and service was great, thanks Victor, yet the price was fair. I'm a burger person and tried one of the best, Ramsay's Burger, and it was a big disappointment because the meat was bland and the fries were stile. If you don't want to wait for hours, pay overprice food, go to wahlburgers. BTW, I'm not paid or smothered to write these experience like those others reviews who are with your essay comment lol and negative reviews. If you expect highend 10 dollar burgers, and complain about it, go to Ramsay's burger.

Great atmosphere, food, and service! We loved Victor and our sub server Jaob (main server went on break). Both were personable and on top of it. Amazing recommendations and we all (4 people) had different items and all agreed amazing. Get you're ass in there!

Awesome variety of gourmet burgers. Got the bacon avocado burger with jalapeños which not only looked picture perfect, but was just as delicious. Got the sweet potato tots which were okay, but the special sauce that came with it was phenomenal. Atmosphere was fun and service was fast. Loved that we got a complimentary picture and that it was non-smoking.

This is a fast food sit down restaurant. Burgers were tasty and fresh. I had mine made into a salad, that was different but a nice change as I try to stay away from bread. Paul's sauce was great as was the sweet potato tots!

First, you will see by my profile this is the first review I've written on Yelp--in fact, I almost never write reviews but felt that this was such a missed expectation that I needed to write something.  Also, I hope the Wahlberg's are reading these reviews because I like the boys and want them to know how the restaurant is operating. 

The Wahlberg's should be embarrassed to have their name on this place.  My wife and i have watched the reality show, fans of the boys, and were optimistic about Wahlburgers.  We made a 2 1/2 hour trip from Columbus for, among other things, a visit to Wahlburgers.

We started by putting our name in for reservations inside.  The hostess said it would be an hour or more. We needed to run an errand so we put our names in anyway.  Our table was ready in 20 minutes so they didn't estimate very well....but I guess better to be seated too early than too late.  

The kitchen was oddly positioned facing the patrons and in the walk way of the patrons.  The waiters were constantly jockeying for position with patrons trying to get to the back patio or their seats---it was an awkward set up.  We were seated very close to the kitchen and the waiters station.  

Because of our seating, we witnessed complete chaos at the waiters station.  The waitresses and waiters seemed listless and milling around the wait station with little urgency.  The kitchen and wait staff were constantly shuffling orders back and forth back to the kitchen because they couldn't keep track of what order was what and they were getting them wrong and confused.  I saw a woman come in from the patio to complain to the manager (or a senior looking person in a golf shirt) and he didn't seem very sympathetic or apologetic.  I saw her pointing, waiving, and getting agitated and he just looked at her....the most he could muster was "I'm sorry" and she stormed away.

It took us (and the couple behind us) almost an hour (58 minutes to be exact) to get our food--2 burgers and an order of fries.  The couple that left as we were getting seated said they waited an hour and 45 minutes.  

Our waitress was unapologetic and marginally attentive.  At 50 minutes in to our wait, I walked up to her at the waiter's station to ask how long it might be and she said "It should be soon".  When I asked what "soon" meant, all she could say is "I don't know, there are several tickets ahead of you."  I was visibly getting frustrated and irritated but she never once offered an acknowledgement, much less an apology attempt to placate me.  In fact, she disappeared for almost 10 minutes and my wife thinks it was to avoid us.

To sum it up:  

--The wait was far too long for just a couple of burgers.
--The service was inattentive, seemingly untrained, and lacked the ability to handle adverse situations.
--The kitchen was chaos and awkwardly located.  It actually increased my anxiety and frustration just to watch them.  They looked completely confused.
--The restaurant was clean but felt more like an amusement park cafeteria than a themed burger restaurant
--If this was a hole in the wall cafeteria, I would still be frustrated but I think I actually found myself a little embarrassed for the Wahlberg's to have their names on the place.  I am sure they all would be appalled at how the place was operating and was perceived.
++The burger and sweet potato tots were pretty good.  Even though it was an hour late, it was fresh, hot and tasted good.

My friend and I went to Wahlburgers the other night. She had already been and said it wasn't half bad.. even going on about how good the onion strings are. I went an ordered the Thanksgiving Burger.. sweet potato tots.. and a strawberry frappe. 

The service was friendly but slow. I was particularly creeped out by a guy who kept staring at me, which made me feel really uncomfortable while we waited for our food. When we got our food, we took it to go. Got home only to find the sweet potato tots pretty bland. They barely added any salt, and definitely NO SEASONING whatsoever. The "frappe" which is said to be made with ice cream, was very artificially flavoured. The one and ONLY THING I enjoyed was the burger. It was a decent size for me with very juicy ground turkey. The stuffing was amazing with a healthy dollop of squash. The touch of cranberry sauce was perfect at the end. 

With all honesty.. I will go back. But only for the thanksgiving burger!!

Over priced. Not great service. Came during lunch ordered my $10 burger without a side included. Server asks me how I want my burger cooked.... ok if you are going to ask you had better have the cooks be able to do it. Ordered medium, got well done. Just don't ask and I won't mind! The cook also must have lost the lid to the seasoning shaker because it tasted like eating a handful of black pepper.  No one has come to check on me or even bring my bill. My server has been busy though, busy flirting with another server. Save the shoulder massages for your own time. In 5 more minutes I will be walking out without paying. Can't pay if I don't recieve a bill.

When In Vegas this place is a must. The food is great and the customer service is outstanding. The bartender Rodrigo always helps us out and he's very attentive and sweet. He's quick on his feet and always makes sure we have everything we need. I usually like to get the melt burger, it's delicious. I will continue to go to Wahlburgers for the great customer service and food.

Honestly, one of the best bacon avocado cheese burgers I've had so far. Soft/toasted bun, really crisply bacon, amazing. 

What really blew me away was the service. I don't understand how this place has a 3 star rating. Our server was on point! Checked on us often, upgraded our drinks, truly great! Rob and Victor, keep up the amazing work. You deserved every bit of that tip you earned.

My friend and I quite enjoyed our burgers, the Our Burger and BBQ burger were both delicious, well seasoned and appropriately topped.  The bun is exceptional and melts with the burger.  Our opinion was the burger was perfectly sized and of a decent  value.   

I wasn't a huge fan of the thinly sliced onion rings but they were tasty.  Maybe the rings need a do-over with thicker rings  but the portion size is generous.

The gluten free truffle cookie was served warm and a  perfect dose of chocolate. 

It's too bad that the place is getting some negative reviews ... If you read them most agree it's a tasty burger ... Isn't that a good thing.   It's worth a trip.  I will definitely go back.

We ate here while on vacation because my daughter and I have been wanting to try it. Food was excellent and place was clean. Are waiter was fantastic. The food took a while but that is expected for a new place they are still learning and will get better but our waiter kept checking in with us letting us know will be a bit. He took 20% off bill because did take a bit and we did not expect that at all but that is good customer service. Will 100% go back.

Burger was just "ok". Service was the most negative, the waiter made us feel stupid by some things he said to us. If you want to hold a conversation with your date, do not go here, the music is really loud! I usually like loud music but not when on a date.

The place is good and I went their with my family in the after noon
We ordered onion rings and some fries
They turned out to be fine 
So I would say so far so good

I got the ODB burger and it was so, so dry. I don't know how they can get ground beef so dry.... The bun was nice but sucked up all of the ketchup, which left the entire burger so, very dry... And the people at the counter suck. They didn't remain aware of the people waiting to order and they moved rely slow. Maybe that's a Canadian thing. But anyways, their burgers are really, really, really dry.

Amazing! Definitely a place to try! The Sloppy Joe is delicious, tastes homemade and beats the best homemade sloppy joe I've had. The Smores milkshake is unlike any I've ever had, so good and rich. Our server Alexandria was so nice and personable. I can't wait to come back!!!

Food Is Delicious, Well Priced. Thank You To Handsome Junior, and amazing accent ! Had wonderful customer service. Had the double decker burger -- huge ! The fries were separate but plenty ! Will definitely come back whenever we are in the area.

My boyfriend and I came in for a couple drinks and apps before seeing a Second City Comedy Show. Our server was sweet, and our food came very fast...no complaints there, but the food was very mediocre and the menu was way too pricey for what you get. Food is served in disposable containers. Honestly i would compare it to an experience I would expect if McDonalds began offering a sit down service- but at a higher price tag. Nothing really truly horrible, but I probably won't be back.

Had the double burger,  tater tots and a frappe.   Bun for the burger was great but the burger patty size was a joke.   Toppings were fresh,  tater tots are just McCain hash brown bites from any supermarket.

Very unimpressive... I ordered a steam whistle, for $7.50 it came in a pop glass and wasn't close to being a pint.... I got the the regular burger $9.95 with tater tots $3.50, tater tots were okay but bland, the burger was bad, very tiny with more condiments then beef, I had a good quarter of my bun left and no beef, the government cheese was terrible and I like processed cheese. The bartender was nice and gave me their secret sauce, the sauce was really good.  I am a huge fan of works burger, the burgers are huge and delicious with endless fries, a way better value and just up the street. Don't waste your time here, friendly staff but the food is terrible!

I had been looking forward to a good burger, and I guess I bought into the hype, so I headed to Wahlburger's on my lunch break. Not such a great decision. I sat at the bar, where I was ignored by three indifferent bartenders for well over 5 minutes even though they weren't busy. The bar seats approx. 12 -15 people I guess, and there weren't more than 7 people seated at it, including me so I'm not sure why I had to wave the guy over in order to get a beer. 

Anyway, I ordered the "Our Burger" (which is supposedly what they built their rep on) and a side of onion rings. When my meal arrived, the burger itself looked great. The onion rings, on the other hand, did not. The menu describes the onion rings as "crispy fried bermuda onion sliced thin, tossed in sea salt & parsley", which apparently means a large bowl of onion strings - the type that belong as a burger topping, and which no one in their right mind would consider or attempt to eat as a side order.

As I said, the burger looked great, but looks were deceiving. A shiny, brioche-style bun was strangely hard, and the burger patty was dry and had the consistency of one that was previously frozen. The toppings were good. That's the best I can say about that. 

Service from the bartender didn't improve either. No one checked to see how my meal was, and it was up to me to motion them over so I could get a fork for the mouthful of onion straws that I ate (definitely not finger food) and later to get a refill on my beer. By the way, props for them at least offering a decent selection of draft instead of the usual macro brewed crap. 

Two beers, a very mediocre burger and a side of onion straws: $33.00.

I am giving a very generous 3 stars. I really wanted to like this place and it just was not good.  Service was fine, but the food was not.  I got an "our burger".  There was so much sauce it turned the bun soggy and the pickles had a fishy taste (so much so I pulled them off) the rest of the burger not a whole lot of flavor.  Put on some mustard hoping to make it better and it helped a little.  The location is fine and again, the service was fine. 

They also have a drink stand on the strip and the frozen margarita was actually very good..  as far as the food, I wouldn't go back.  When in the burger mood, I'll stick with in-n-out or fat burger.

I recommended this restaurant to an out of town VIP client that wanted a 'great burger'. They wanted to try something the Bay Area did not have; Five Guys and In 'N Out was out of the question. They also were not looking for a foie gras with gold flakes rendition of a burger. They just wanted a 'great burger'. I normally only recommend to my friends and clients places that I personally have made a cameo before, but somehow I don't know why I said "Wahlburgers". So off they go!  The next day, I see my clients and they asked why I had sent them there!  I will spare all of you the details my clients gave me, but I needed to try this for myself. So I decided to go the next day as soon as they opened around 11 a.m. so I could avoid the tourist lines.  Although there was no wait at around 11:30ish, there was a good deal of patrons already sitting inside the restaurant including the bar.  I decided to take a seat at the outside bar stool which was probably my biggest mistake. They air ducts pushing air out to keep bugs from coming in to the restaurant were at full blast!  I felt I was Donna Summers in concert when she sings in front of an air blower to push her wild hair all over the place!  I could have easily moved, but there truly was no other place to sit at the bar at this point.  I ordered a Blue Moon while the bartender brought me a menu.  As I took my first sip, I scanned the location of this property and it immediately gave me a flashback of when I was in Bangkok eating by the public markets watching a cobra being tamed! At least in Bangkok there was some great views...This location is containers converted to shops, and very loud. There is construction everywhere.  If you think you will have location of the Strip, think again....this is not the place for you.  But alas....I am here to review the food.  The burger was decent, nothing great.  I asked the bartender to substitute the raw onions for grilled, they decided to charge me the additional $1 for it even though it was a substitute.  Of course, when I got my burger, there was no onions at all.  I decided not to wait for the onions and told the bartender to 86 the onions from my bill. She didn't apologize, but just said she would take it off my bill.  

Overall, the food is okay.....the burger was good; cooked to my temperature, tater tots were nothing to brag about; you could find these at your local elementary school during mystery meat Friday's. The service.... not the best. They need to work on it.  Bartender was confused and truly didn't care whether or not the order was correct. You could tell she was just clocking in and clocking out to get base salary and tips.  

I can see why my clients from San Francisco lectured me on my choice of restaurant.  The two stars is for the ice cold Blue Moon I had and they were able to get my burger patty medium rare. Love the Wahlberg family; great actors and singers, but stick to your Calvin Klein panties and leave the restaurant industry to those who get it.  Also, I would look for a new scout location manager, no offense...could have done better with the property.

Very poor not good at all not worth the  money or the time.. I came from California to Lasvegas to eat this place! And it was not worth it ppl in there was not nice and the food was under cook never again I will go back here also I did speak with the manager his name is Edgar he was horrible he was very unrespectable and did not understand how me and my family felt they gave us undercooked food and I told him about it and he said they're sorry and that there is nothing he can do about it he didn't even offer to make my food again. Don't think he should be placed as a manager or that position of that kind of him not helping people the way how it is meant to be a manager I think Donnie Wahlberg kind of did better with his employment and stuff he needs to come back and take care of things I don't think it's right for them to give undercooked food to cook too customers! I give this place a thumbs down it is not worth taking your time or your family to this place I rather eat McDonald's then here sorry... Just speaking the truth

actually 2 1/2 stars. Stopped in for a burger with a few buddies.The burger was good, the poutine was bad. The waitress was clueless. 
Overall just okay.
We would not return.
Not impressed. Overpriced Steak 'n Shake size burger patties. Bun was stale. Gluten bun was even worse!

I would expect more specially i like the show, but it didn't really wow my taste buds. I ordered the melt burger and it end up being over cooked instead of my order of medium well. Theirs allot of employees standing around and just talking to one another instead of building connection with customers specially new ones whose just visiting Vegas!

Ate @ the Las Vegas Wahlburger eatery today and was far from impressed. Found out from the waitress the restaurant opened just last week so perhaps some of the issues are just growing pains for a new place. Waitress was cordial & attentive, but the wait for my wife's  burger, my ceasar salad & chicken strips for our son was over 45 minutes. Saw two tables just get up & go... tired of the wait.  Food was good, especially my wife's burger, but nothing extraordinary. Two Specialty  drinks were delicious, but pricey... but then what isn't in Las Vegas?  Caught an $8.00 billing error, which they gladly corrected. Total bill was $68 & change. $31 of that was the two drinks from the bar. Overerall, with all the choices available in LV this place needs to cut down the wait time.

We went fairly late in the night, after a long day in the city. The staff were super friendly, we didn't have to wait at all to be greeted and shown where to go order for take out. The girls behind the take out counter were really awesome in helping us make our decision. We had to wait a little for our food, but considering it is made fresh, the wait really wasn't that long. The quality of the food is awesomez fresh, hot and exactly how we asked for it. The fries were delicious and also stayed hot on our walk back to our hotel. 
I went in because of the show, but I will absolutely be returning because of the fantastic staff and delicious food.
I would highly recommend giving it a try.
Hands down the best burger I have ever tasted. Better than any other burger place on the strip!

I fly in and out of YYZ a lot, thought I would try wahlburgers since I had time to kill before boarding. Sat at the bar, very friendly server. Ordered a BBQ bacon burger with poutine. 30 minutes went by, saw several people that came in after me get their food. Server came by and asked if I wanted anything else as if I was just finishing my drink and ready to go. When I asked about my burger she had a panicked look on her face and ran to check on it. Turns out it never got cooked. Had to take the burger to go and eat it on the plane since 45 minutes passed and my plane was boarding. Poutine was good, burger seemed average. Maybe it did not taste as good since the lame service pissed me off.

Great location, everything else sucks about this franchise. The pricing is high, even for the area. Let's not forget that by eating here you're also supporting Mark Wahlberg who violently attacked a Vietnamese man in a race related assault.

Really disappointed in the menu.  Only about 1/4 of it was burgers, and I didn't feel there were any really unique options to choose from.  Of course it's located on the strip so it's over-priced, but my hubby and I paid $47 after tax & tip for 2 burgers, one side of fries and one side of tater tots.  His burger, the "our burger" with double patties and bacon was pretty good but I could've experienced the same quality at FatBurger or some hole in the wall burger joint for half the price or less.  Also, was not impressed at the LACK of motif in the restaurant.  The service was fine, but the restaurant...nothing special.  There are a million "gourmet" burger places on the strip. I suggest to go to any of the others...

I was really excited to go here after watching Wahlburgwrs on tv and all that jazz. I liked the onion rings and fries. But... the ranch dressing tasted like it was mixed with 100 proof balsamic vinaigrette? Why??? WHY. I wanted to cry.

Came here last night because my man and I had heard mixed reviews about Wahlburgers and wanted to try it for ourselves. Also, I've had a thing for Mark Wahlburg since my childhood, but don't tell my man that! 

The place is a lot bigger than we expected, with a seated table-service area in the front and take out in the back and upstairs. We liked the decor; it's perfect for the area with the Skydome (or Rogers Centre, whatever) nearby because it has a more upscale sports bar vibe. Good for groups and kids too! 

As for the food - I ordered the Thanksgiving burger (their turkey option) and regular tots, while my boyfriend ordered the BBQ Bacon burger with the sweet potato tots. We both really enjoyed our food. I will admit that the burgers do look a little small when you receive them (especially if you order the 5 oz. like I did), but these burgers are more about height than width and are definitely filling. The portions of tots are quite large, I had to get my boyfriend to help me out with mine. I will say that my tots were too salty and I kind of wished I ordered the sweet potato ones, as they were definitely more flavourful, but that's my own fault. I was also disappointed that there was no sparkling water and I was served tonic water instead. Yuck.
