A burger and a side comes in just under $15, which is pretty standard for fancier burger places in Toronto. Not sure why so many people are complaining about the price when most are quick to shell out $12 for McDonald's and their mystery ingredients without a complaint...

Will be back.

Anybody that gives this burger joint more than 2 stars is obviously a friend on the payroll of the owners.
Went there today after a Blue Jay game around 4 PM.  Never been although we live around the corner.  But, hey gotta patronize local eateries, right?
Wrong.!~!!! 
The BBQ burger at $9.95 was as dreary as all the other reviews state.
It was Luke warm, small, and covered with a few extras that were all pretty much a mush of stuff.
Bun was tiny but I guess for the tiny meat patty it was in order. The bun was above cardboard by a bit.  Totally inappropriate for a specialty place that makes a big deal about its burgers.
No plate to dip your fries in ketchup so we put a nappy on the table and poured the ketchup on it. The fries were undistinguished and don't even give Big Mac fries a run for the money.
Thank goodness for Harvey's and their affordable and wonderful meat patties and real fries.
But if you drink enough of Wahlburger's booze you might be happy with the food.

Yummy! There was a wait for a table so sat at the bar. Fast service from the bar! Bartenders were very friendly and made you feel comfortable. The food was fast coming out- took less than 10 minutes. Tried the 1/3 burger, mama's sloppy joe and the Mac and cheese. The food was great, no complaints.

Not going to lie, I was a bit disappointed here. After much time knowing about the restaurant, I was finally able to try it out while I was in Vegas and it didn't live up to all the hype. The prices are pretty high for the size of the burgers AND the sides. Ordered onions rings as a side and they came out as onion straws (needs to be said or shown clearly). Most expensive shake I've ever had and it was not anything special. Sadly I won't be trying it again :(

My family and I (husband and 18yr old, 13 and 14 yrs old) were walking the strip trying to find something semi-quick, we had tickets to a show, there wasnt a wait here  so we sat down. Waited about 10 min before we were waited on. Between us we got 3 cheeseburgers a hot dog, a cup of tater tots and a salad, 1 beer and 3 soft drinks came to 80.60! Sitting there waiting on our food, we wondered why some people had white paper cups while we had big green reusable cups, we find out when e got our bill! 4.95 a cup, we were not given the option for the disposable cups. For a family of 5 that quickly adds up. Cheeseburgers were good but daughters salad the cesaser dressing had no taste to it.  Not worth the price.
Expensive. 17 dollars for a burger and fry. Food is good but that's as expensive as the restaurants in Vegas and you'll leave hungry.

Not sure whether I should classify this place as a sport bar or a fast food burger place. My classic burger (aka Our Burger on the menu) was served cold, too small for me and nothing that I would say omg about. Burger priest is way better than here. Service was slow however since they just opened a few days ago, it will take them few weeks to settle down. Also they charge by default 18% extra for dine-in which is rare for this class of restaurant.

What a colossus disappointment, giving 1 star is being extremely generous!!. If you are looking for burgers and double burgers disguised as sliders, you will love it. As we open our meal and noticed this terrible burger, we called the manager and asked if by someway we received someone's else's kids order. She was no help ,,.,,.,,,,,,,don't want to ramble here but the Walburg  family should be ashamed of themselves serving this garbage....... My advice is if you want to enjoy a good burger, just go somewhere else, anywhere that serves a burger is better then this garbage .

If it wasn't for the family name, this place would be out of business. We had the thanksgiving sandwich and the melt. The thanksgiving sandwich was pretty flavorless and the melt was EXTREMELY greasy. And the music they play is all depressing 90s and early 2000s rock. Not the most upbeat when having a burger and cocktails. Pros: the drinks were good, the staff was friendly and the fries were nice and crispy.

Had such a blast here with my friends. Sat at the bar where you could enjoy the fresh air. They had vegetarian substitutes for my friend which our server informed us about. Abigail was very attentive to all of our needs.

Ordered the beast, added sautéed mushrooms and cheddar cheese. Pretty good tasting burger. Their french fries are the worst I have ever had. They have no flavor, no salt, very bland. The server is bot very attentive to refill drinks.

Yelp seems to really give Wahlburgers a hard time. People need to realize that is not a fancy place. It's your typical burger joint but with a little bit more. I love the food the service is great and it's my favourite place to go after a game. Yelp people need to stick to there own fancy places and stop picking on others.

The food is good, but the portion sizes and prices make it a difficult place to want to re-visit.  I had the chicken burger, which was juicy and spilling over with toppings.  Their buns are tasty, but too small for the burgers.

The deep fried tater tots were also quite good.  Really, how can a deep fried tater tot be bad?

My total for the burger and tots was $16 and change, with tip $20.  I'm also a pretty small person and I left hungry.

The restaurant is rather large and in a pricey, touristy area so I understand the pricing.  Unfortunately it means this will probably just be a tourist hang out.
Service at lunch time was so friendly.  Ordered a burger and tater tots and the house made lemonade.  Everything was so good. Will definitely go back.

Lunchtime. 

Well what to say about this place. 
One its owned by a famous person which brought me here. 
Two l love the food here it's alway fresh and on time. Their garden salad are my favorite with a chicken burger.
Russell B at Wahlburgers Pittsburgh. Great service, great food and friendly staff. Clean bathrooms. Gluten free options are wonderful!
Ok. $30 for two burgers and a small tater tots. Decent burger if you're in the area, but you can get way better for way less elsewhere.

I was really excited to eat here but am sorely disappointed. The experience was ho hum. I wasn't going to review the place but when the outrageous bill came I knew I had to. 

Drinks
Adult Frappes- Fluffanuttahh and Mud Pie (to thick to drink out of their tiny straws and I doubt there is even any alcohol in there)

Food
The Melt and a Double Decker (bland, the wahl sauce didn't add anything special and the bun got soggy quickly)
Yukon Fries (tasted just like every other restaurant fry)
Onion Rings (best thing we ate)

Total cost $72.00!!!!

I could have got a real dinner for that price and it probably would have been memorable. 

I was also surprised at the bad restaurant arrangement. You don't realize until you sit down that you can order food from the counter to go and their isn't much sitting room. The room is super loud at 4pm. 

Other surprise- the lack of branding and cheap feel of the location. All drinks were served out of plastic and paper cups with no branding. Ketchup was a no-name brand. One wall mural, 1 family picture and a bunch of blank walls where something should be. 

Lastly the location is horrible. Behind all the weird little shops that feel like a flea market. I figured it would be open to the city and you're surround by walls. You'd think they have the money to choose a prime spot. 

Wasn't the experience I was hoping for and I wouldn't go back. 

Don't go unless your just wanting to look around. Your pocketbook will thank you.

Dear Wahlburgers - we are avid watchers of your show since day one, we have been really excited about coming to the Las Vegas location ever since we saw the beginnings of it starting to be built. Super bummed out tonight to come here after an incredible concert and have what tastes like frozen tater tot's and onion rings that were tasteless and disappointing as well as a barbecue burger with very little meat in the potty no taste of the guacamole, no sign of the tasty barbecue sauce we were hoping for and flavorless jalapeños. I'm bummed out because the burgers you promote on your show look amazing. You may want to come here quick and revamp this before it continues to go downhill. We hope you can put some TLC into this location so that I will be as good as the burgers we see on tv.

Delicious! I ordered the "Our Burger" with onion rings & was not disappointed. The patty was cooked perfectly and paired nicely with the thinly sliced onion rings. I topped it off with a spiked lemonade. A great meal to get me through a night of Vegas drinking. Definitely coming back on my next visit!

Really unimpressive fare.  I had the double decker with lettuce, tomato, pickles and Wahl sauce.  The patties were okay, frozen is my guess, but the bun just really stands out as the worst part of the experience - it was too large and the bottom was stale.  I had the 'crispy onion rings' as a side, which sounds great, however it's just a large bowl of frizzled onions - the kind The Keg serves with their steaks, only these are much less cooked and would make a better topping than a heaping bowl of lightly fried onion side dish. The decor is reminiscent of a Sobeys.   They actually sell 'Wahl Gear' in their gift shop.  You could find a better meal anywhere in the city.

Certainly an above average burger joint. When i walked in it seemed loud and crowded but it didn't feel claustrophobic when we sat down. The wait staff was laid back but friendly. Sports bar decor, with wall to wall flat screens showing sports and video montages. Being a Marky Mark fan, the shameless advertising didn't bother me so much as make me want to go home and netflix one of his movies.

The Menu descriptions are charming ("Triple decker: a triple stack, like the house we grew up in"). The topping combinations were appealing, I had the "OFD" with mushrooms, swiss, tomato jam and bacon, which was as you can imagine quite tasty. Poutine was good, the cheese was plentiful and the gravy was beefy. The onion rings were actually onion strings, which weren't bad, but i wouldn't choose it again. You did get a good portion size, though, since more were able to fit in the cup. 

The main thing: the patty. I have rather high standards and have never paid for one that is better than what my dad makes. But it didn't taste like a frozen or processed, it tasted like fresh ingredients. I was happy.

I left having had enjoyed myself.

Oh! and the hard plastic chairs were surprisingly comfortable!

This place hit the spot! We came on a Monday afternoon when it was not very busy. Had just a 5-10 min wait. The burgers were amazing, specifically the "thanksgiving dinner" burger, it's to die for! Glad I gave this place a shot.
This is a great burger place. I've been to the ones in Atlanta and Vegas. I especially love that you can get any burger patty on top of a salad.

Tried this place tonight thinking it's probably decent and that previous reviewers got it wrong. Not so. 

The burger I got was a double BBQ bacon burger.  

The good:
Let me say that the flavours were pretty damn good! Good mix of jalapeño, avocado & sauce
Fries were good. Takeout service was friendly.

The bad: 
It was tiny! I was starving so I got a double thinking it would fill me up. Not so. These are not than much bigger than a slider in diameter at least. Fries & burger $17+-

Needless to say I won't be back. What could have been!!
horrible, horrible, horrible.  food, service price.  it's an overpriced tourist trap.  Pease do yourself a favor, go to in n out.
Stopped at the Merchant booth and hung out with Brittany!!! Great conversation, awesome service! Definitely stop for a seat, a drink and a bit of cool air!! Thanks girl!!

Went on a Tuesday around 1pm. It's was a 20 minute wait time.  Host staff seemed nice but didn't seem to know what was going on between the three of them!  After we were seated 10 minutes later our waitress came over just to tell us she would be with us in a moment.  We did not see her again for about 5 minutes. She asked what we wanted we just ordered two waters and waited another 10 minutes just to get water.  Now 20 minutes after being there we finally get something to drink and are able to order .  My husband ordered the 2 hot dogs and I ordered the Jenny Chicken sandwich.  We did not get our food for 35 minutes.  We had to ask for silverware and our waitress never asked if we needed refills for our drinks we had to ask her for refills and took her over 5 minutes to get us refills.  As we were eating we watched our waitress drop food on the floor clearing a table and clean it up with her hands.  I watched her and she never washed her hands she went and picked up a food order.  I will say the food was amazing but the wait staff will take this place under.  As much as I liked the food I probably won't be back due to the wait staff . All in all we waited over an hour to get food and drinks.   Our waitress name was Margaret and was very overwhelmed.

For a burger place, their burgers could really use some work...

Burger sizes are a bit disappointing, patty tastes okay (bit dry, not very flavourful), and buns were atrocious (super dry, cold bottom, flaky crumbly top). It reminded me of stale 5 day old buns. 

Pass on this and take your $15 somewhere else.
Jenn's chicken sandwich was amazing. Service was great (we sat at and ate into the bar) And honestly a pretty good price.

Terrible service.  30 minutes to get a side of fries after ordering glass of wine, which I had to remind my server twice to get the glass of wine.
Watched as customers were trying to get served , or served part of their order.....
Heard " sorry about that" over and over again by bartender-servers. They either need more help or a better system.
Fine I guess.  Nothing special at all. I hope it goes out of biz and is replaced with a shake shack. Service was fine but maybe weird. Burger was slop on a bun.

I'm just going to start out by saying that this was seriously the BEST burger I have ever eaten in my life and I love burgers but seriously hands down the best. My boyfriend and I had just flown out to Vegas 4th of July weekend which we so happened to stumble upon a sign that said Wahlburger  on the strip and in both our thoughts we were like okay we are definitely going to try this place while we are here. So we made it upon our selfs Friday to walk there to eat when we got the the place it definitely looked packed which it was the wait time was 45 minutes and we definitely did not want to wait that long so we just decided to go the next day (we didn't realize that it has just opened up)So Saturday we go there and it even looked busier then the last day which it was because the wait time now was 1 hour and 45minutes. Definitely was disappointed but we told our selfs that Monday we have to go there since it would be our last full day in Vegas because we were heading back home Tuesday evening. So Monday morning came and we got up early got ready and headed down to see when they opened (9am is when we went there) we found out that they opened at 11am we wanted a burger there so bad and to try it out that we waited all the time so we could be the first people inline. At about 10am the manager peeked his head out to just reassure to us that we knew they opened at 11 and then i responded to him assuring him that we new but we wanted to try the place so bad we didn't mind waiting because the last two days we had tried to come the the restaurant to eat but it was such a long wait. So finally it was 11 and sure enough we were the first people that got to be seated because around 10:20-10:30 a line started forming. Anyways the burger I got was the O.F.D my boyfriend got the double decker we also got sides of sweet potato tots and thin crispy onion rings and two drinks. We got our food so fast after we ordered everything the service I'm giving a 5 star because even when we were eating people who weren't even our server kept walking up to us asking if we needed anything or how everything was. We could not believe how amazing and good of quality the food was, the burgers were cooked so perfect and I highly recommend to anyone that you need to order the thin crispy onion rings they are seriously so goooooood!! And the most amazing part of the experience is that when we asked for our check the waitress told us that the manager wanted us to have it on the house because we waited all the time till they opened. So good service, great food and I liked the atmosphere also everyone must go! And if we could get one in Seattle I would honestly go like all the time
No vegetarian options other than a portobello burger. Staff recommended the haddock as a vegetarian option. It's 2016.

Wahlburger finally comes to Toronto, it's been open for awhile. Even though the place is pretty close to me, I haven't tried it until tonight. Based on the reviews, it's been a mix of hits and misses, some likes it, some hates it. We decided to do the take-out instead of the restaurant part which was in the front of the restaurant. The take-out was at the back and they have seating at the back and some upstairs. You can avoid to pay the automatic 18% gratuity!

They have a variety of selection of burgers to chose from. I decided to try the Thanksgiving Day burger as it is the first time I have heard of it so it's worth trying. It is like having Thanksgiving leftovers on a bun with ground turkey, stuffing, orange cranberry sauce, roasted butternut squash & mayonaise. I actually like it, it wasn't as greasy compared to other beef burgers. And it went great with the stuffing and squash. The burger was unique, worth trying! The burgers are smaller compared to the other gourmet burgers, I was hungry after a few hours compared to others where I would be stuff for the night. We got some sides as well, the onion rings were really good. Not your usually one big ring but its shredded onions with seasoning and battered then fried.

The wait, even for take out was pretty long. As they serve in the same kitchen so they are cooking for the restaurant and take out. So if you are tight for time, you might have to leave some buffer time. We waited for about 20 minutes for the food.

Too bad, we did not see Mark!

Seasoning goes a LONG WAY... they should try it! Tasteless and bland.  The burgers from my kitchen taste better.  The hotdog my kiddo got was the best thing served! Very disappointed.  I'd compare it to McDonalds... but if I had to choose, I think I'd pick McDs!

Before heading back home to Los Angeles, My family and I finally had the chance to eat at Wahlburgers and ... it was worth the wait. My husband is very picky and he enjoyed it. He tried Mama's favorite (Sloppy Joe), I had Donny's favorite (BBQ, Jalapeño, Cheese and Avocado Burger), my uncle had the Classic Cheeseburger, and my 10 year old daughter had their JR. Cheeseburger (plain). As side orders we had Yukon Fries and Sweet Potato Tots which were delicious. We also ordered a Neapolitan milkshake... perfect with chunks of strawberries. The bill came out to $84 and change (little high), however the food didn't disappoint.

Really wanted to like this place.  Love the tv show, love the story.  Don't love the menu, food or quality.

Not at all as one would expect.

Arrived to a 50 minute wait for a table.  Fine, if the food was to die for...but sadly the food was like a truck stop diner on the I-15. 

Waitress was a doll.  Loved her.  My husband and I looked at the menu and were puzzled.  Where are all of the specialty burgers?  Where's all of the pizzaz???  I asked the waitress, "Stupid question, but, is this the full menu?  I thought there were specialty burgers?"

Sadly, our waitress notified us that this IS the full menu..all 6 or so burgers.  Nothing to write home about (except that they use "government" cheese and some Wahl sauce which on one seems to know what it is).

Ordered the BBQ burger with avocado.  Yuck!!! The edges had very clearly been pulled from a pre-cooked 6 pack of buns.  There were tell tale signs of the leftover bread tag from the other buns.  I grabbed it, and, the whole bottom was cold.  Yes, cold.  The burger patty was maybe 1/8 inch thick, crusty and bent, hanging over the smooshed bun.  There was maybe one slice of avocado on the whole burger and even less BBQ sauce.

The fries were old and dry.  The sweet potato tater tots were definitely pre-cooked and frozen.

Booo.  I really, really wanted to like this place.  Sadly, won't ever be going back.

In one of the busiest cities! I stopped here for a quick meal, sat at the bar and was greeted by bartender Rodrigo! I ordered the chopped salad bowl with a water as well as a rum and pineapple and the mix was perfect. Delicious.It's so hard in Vegas to find someone who is so friendly and at the same time professional with great service in the food industry. Thank you!

People need to realize it is a soft opening. With that said, I thought it was great! Great service and great atmosphere. I think it'll get better with time once they get ahold of things. Their patty melt was so good. Their mustard was amazing (and homemade) and I'm not a mustard fan. The onion rings are so so so good!

I expected a lot more coming here due to the celebrity status and the fact that they have a tv show about the restaraunts. 

To start, we entered and one of the grills was broken so they were only able to seat 30 people so we were wait listed but asked to leave while we waited.

When our table was ready we were put at a 2 top squished in the corner, I kid you not... Squished. 

Our server was nice but not on top of things. We ordered and she didn't write it down properly I guess so she had to come back and ask twice what we ordered. My drink was also empty and she walked by multiple times and I had to stop her to order another drink. 

The food took a while and when It came it was barely warm- almost cold. The burger was kind of dry and lacked flavour (our burger) and my boyfriend had "the melt" which he was disappointed it was just a burger in between two peices of bread which were grilled. tater tots were awesome but they were cold when they came out. 

Overall, we wanted to see what the hype was about but won't be returning. Over priced for what it is. If you want a great burger joint- hit up holy chuck burgers at yonge and st. Clair !

I was extremely excited that Wahlburgers was coming to Toronto, but waited until the hype was over before I gave it a try, plus with the mixed reviews, I didn't make it a priority for my to-go places to try.

For being an establishment from the Wahlberg brothers, I was expecting a great place, good service and amazing food, but was quite disappointed that it didn't deliver according to the hype.  It was comfort food, but at gourmet sizes and prices.

Upon entering through the first door, there's a warning on the wall of being videotaped or recorded, then through the second door, there's brightness from all the greenery decor.  Decent size seating area with full-sized bar and lots of TVs throughout the restaurant.  Like other Yelpers had commented, it felt like I walked into a sports bar.

Luckily there was some sort of walkway that guided me to the ordering counter.  Menu  items were clearly displayed and I thought the prices were quite reasonable because normal prices for good burgers with fries in restaurants ranges from $12 - $18 on average.

I came late Sunday afternoon and there was no line-up, but a group of people waiting for their orders off to the side. The cashier didn't seem friendly and I felt like I had bothered her with my smile while I waited for her to acknowledge me so I can place my order.  

I managed to place my order of BBQ Bacon Burger ($9.95) and Yukon Gold Fries ($3.50), then proceeded to the side to wait while observing the staff.  The two cashiers didn't look happy and the kitchen staff looked miserable from what I saw and it wasn't even that busy. 

Although I indicated that I was dining in to the cashier, receipt showed takeout, hence, my order came in a white paperbag with the Wahlburgers logo even when I tried to stop the other cashier from placing my food in the paperbag informing her I was dining in.  So much for trying to save a paper bag. Nice packaging for the burger and cute container for the fries, but what a major disappointment when I opened the burger box.  I was very shocked to see how small the burger was.  

For the price of $9.95, I was expecting a normal size burger, but what I received was a burger that resembled something slightly larger than a slider. Plus the bun looked like it was manhandled with all the dents on it.  I was hungry, so took a quick photo before taking my first bite.  I wasn't impressed at all.  Too much BBQ sauce that seemed to overpower the burger, cheese wasn't melted all the way, plus I only tasted avocado near the end and almost forgot it was part of the burger.  It seemed like they forgot and only placed a dollop of avocado, perhaps that explained the manhandled bun which didn't taste fresh. The saving grace was the bacon which was done nicely and crispy.

The fries were quite tasty and I ate them plain since it was nicely salted, but for $3.50 it just doesn't seem worth the price for the small amount I received.

I think I would rather have my burger and fries elsewhere.  At least I can say I tried Wahlburgers.  Sadly, this will be my first and last visit.
Going to Wahlburgers was like kissing marky mark with Hollywood cheese and special mayo for a good hour or so. Yum yum yum....
This place sucks. McDonald's is a step above. Burger sucked. Fries sucked. Service was mediocre. Won't go there again.

I first eat at your restaurant while in Vegas and loved it! And now that you have a restaurant in Pittsburgh we have eaten there twice now.. Thank you so much for com I g to my hometown!! Steelers Nation

Meh - food was cold when we got it.  Service was very slow.  The onion rings - weren't.  Looked like a blooming onion from the Outback met TNT.  Also flavorless.  The special sauce was MIA, and the Cesar salad was warm and limp.  Not worth the price or the on TV hype.  Staff seemed confused and lacking in any motivation whatsoever.

Disappointed.

Had a great cheeseburger and French fries here. Sat outside on the patio and the atmosphere was very nice and cool despite the Las Vegas evening heat. A three piece band was playing in the courtyard which added to the festive atmosphere. After so many super expensive Vegas restaurants, I was glad that this one didn't break the bank. My local $5 beer called Bonanza was also tasty. Total bill was about $15 or so.

First - what I liked - the burger itself. I got their basic Wahlburger, and it tasted like something that you would have on your back porch at a good bbq party. I liked it. And yes, it was $9 - but that's what you're going to pay for a burger in downtown Toronto.

I also liked the multitude of sports screen options, and plenty of tables to sit at. The hostess was very nice and sat me promptly.

What wasn't so great - I get that it's Wahlburgers - but do we have to see a loop of everything Mark and Danny Wahlberg have done their whole lives? It plays on the screen 24/7 - and it more makes you realize this guys have been in more duds than actual hits. Don't get me wrong - I like Mark W. (was never really an NKOTB fan - nothing against Danny), but I don't need this.

I think people are going to find the prices too high, and the fad of it may wear off quickly, but I would probably eat there again in a pinch. Let's face, Gretzky's across the street isn't known for having reasonably priced fare, and that's been there forever.

Burger........it was ok but nothing special, not for ten bucks. The fries........a scrawny order made from frozen fries, came to the table luke warm. Three and a half bucks. Service...........fast, but it felt like they wanted me to eat and get out of there.

There are some way better burger joints in this city, and some of them even have fresh cut fries. I'll keep going back to my regular burger stop.

Woth the $14+ for lunch.  Nope. I was the only person in the take out line at lunch time.  After ordering their most basic burger and an order of fries.  I asked the cashier what "government" cheese was..I was embarrassed for her when she mumbled.. sans emotion  "it's a Kraft single" .  After ordering, I waited and waited and waited.  As the cashier tapped her pen on the counter I interupted her daydream to ask if there was any faster service for take out orders or am I in line with all the dining room orders (btw the dining room was quite full) Her response was simple.  No faster service for take out.  Great so I continued to wait with anticpation. When I got back to the office and opened the box, I was horrified to see a shrivelled bun with what I think was a hamburger patty. Was too small to actually tell.  Save your money people of Toronto.  Even if the food was good (and the cheese was actually cheese) I would avoid this place with their lack lustre service and unfriendly staff.  Walberg family, you can do better.

Really good food and service. The thanksgiving day burger is delicious. The atmosphere inside is a bit weird with the bright green chairs but the food and service makes that better. The fries are really good as well.

The food was good, once we finally saw it.  We went for lunch at 2 in the afternoon and waited 50 minutes for a few sandwiches and two salads.  When we asked how much longer it was going to be, the server said he would check and never came back.  Overall, with the amount of choices, I just don't think you should have to wait that long for a burger.

Wanted to try this place out since my friends and I were all hungry. I got the Our Burger and it was okay. I'm a big fan of pickles and their pickles were too dry. I was excited because their pickles were big and then got disappointed. Price paid wasn't worth it to me.

First time here and probably the last.  Met friends who came up from out of town at 2pm on a Saturday.  Was told 30-35 minute wait for a table when we got there.  25 minutes later we were seated.  Pleasantly surprised, as I had read negative reviews about longer than expected wait times.  We waited a little longer than normal for our waiter to come by, and by that time we had already looked over the menu and were ready to order, so he took our drink and food order at the same time.  Didn't have to wait too long on drinks.  Our food came out about 50 minutes after we'd been seated.  Nothing to write home about.  It wasn't horrible  but I've had better burgers.  It was an enjoyable lunch with friends I hadn't seen in a while, but next time we'll meet in the burbs with plenty of free parking.

Wahlbergers, good TV show, burgers - not so much. Had a Paul's special last night. Kind of a cross between an In-and-Out single and a single pattie BigMac. Sent the first one back because it was undercooked and cold like it came from the refrigerator. Second one was warmed to room temperature (still not hot enough to melt the cheese). They felt bad so they gave me a 20% discount off the $12 burger. Awesome, $10 for a room temperature burger and $14 for a beer... I feel special?

Excellent service and friendly staff upon arrival.  I loved the menu, nothing too lengthy, but creative enough burgers to add some variety. 

I asked for recommendations and the waitress obliged. I decided on the chili to start, the OFD Burger, and the onion rings. 

Chili-  really good flavor and extremely hearty.  
Rings- a giant basket of thinly sliced and fried rings straws with a garnish and sauce.  Good flavor, but couldn't eat the full side. 
Burger-  super soft bun and a great burger with a good variety of flavors stacked on top of a 1/2 lb burger patty.

Really really good meal, and excellent service.  I even contemplated buying a shirt, but had to leave.

I wanted to like this place. It's nice looking, the staff is friendly, and it definitely has appeal with the Wahlberg family name behind it.

But restaurants are about food. My wife and my two teenage children ate here. The "chopped salad" was just lettuce on a plate, the onion rings had virtually no onions to speak of, and the burgers were flavourless. My daughter liked her Mac and Cheese, but you really have to be incompetent to bung that one up.

So expensive, tasteless food? "Eek! Methinks" is a well-earned rating. Sad, really, especially with all the smiling faces on the walls and the motto of "Making you happy, makes us happy" plastered everywhere. I really felt ripped-off eating here.

Good food, horrible service at the bar, would of been better off at a table. Bartender looked to be new, might be since this place just opened but you have to be able to at least keep an eye on your customers. Had to ask for everything, to order, refills, check. Trying to pay the bill, took almost 10 minutes and at an airport people stopping in for a quick bite to eat don't have a lot of time.

The wife and I love the show so we had to visit the Vegas location. The staff was very friendly and the Burgers were fantastic. The bill for two Burgers and a Drink came to 54.00 a bit steep and would return but wouldn't make a special trip due to the prices. 5 Star for the good Food,and great staff. Was a very clean establishment. If you order a drink from the bar and want the plastic cup be ready to give up a 20.00 Bill I guess that is what increased our bill.

Oh my this place is all it's cracked up to be!!! The burgers are insane and the onion rings are so freaking awesome and to top the night off with a New England favorite grilled fluff peanut butter chocolate and banana sandwich holy cow!!!! The service was great the atmosphere an over all great time and recommend for everyone to try!!

Never expect much for airport food. Took 10 minutes just for one of the three bartenders working to ask me for my drink order. Got the caeser salad which was really nothing special. No check in by any of the three bartenders who didn't seem busy at all. Off putting smell from beer taps which clearly had not been cleaned or sanitized made clear by the swarming black flies. Pretty gross and pathetic overall experience at this joint.

There wasn't anything hint too unique with the burger, so in terms of price it's overpriced.  Got the Our Burger (around 10 Canadian dollars).  Meat is heavier than say a regular cheeseburger from In and Out.  But taste wise, it was similar to a burger you would get from a BBQ at a park.  Fries were good, better than In and Out (crispier, more golden).

Service was decent.
3 1/2 stars food was shitty, But i really enjoyed Pain and Gain. #bluebloods #coldfood #thisresturantdissapointedthefunkybunch

My husband chose Wahlburgers as his birthday dinner.  There were 5 of us.  We were a little nervous because there was an Indians game and a Cleveland and a concert at the Q - but our wait was only about 20 minutes. After we were seated, we ordered 4 waters WITH LEMON and a bourbon beer and sweet potato tater tots to start.

The tater tots were absolutely delicious.  Waitress forgot the lemons, and they ran out of the beer we wanted.  They also "ran out of cups, but got the plastic ones ones our water was served in from "somewhere" - a little sketchy" 

Anyway, on to food, we had 3 burgers, they were good, not the best I've ever had, but not the worst either.  A portabella mushroom burger, was good.  And a Mom's sloppy joe - which my mom said was good.  So over all the food was good.
Also ordered the onion rings (which were really onion straws), but in my opinion were the highlight of the dinner. 

A few things:
* they didn't have lemons (despite being a restaurant and full service bar)
* the special Wahl-sauce tasted like ketchup, mayo and water
* the BBQ sauce tasted just like the Wahl-sauce
* they "ran out of cups"
* I don't understand the wire baskets instead of plates, plastic silverware and paper cups format - I wish it wa
* the waitress had "no clue" what the feature burger was
* the check in process was a pad of paper, which the host wrote our name and phone number - took forever 
* despite being seated within 20 minutes, it took about 10 minutes for the waitress to greet us, and then about 30 minutes for the food to come to the table 
* everything was ala carte - so the $9 burger, plus $3.50 side was pretty expensive for "average"  especially if you want a 

Overall I think it was good - and hopefully because it's new they are going through growing pains, and once they get their ordering system up and running, as well as fully trained staff (our waitress was not knowledgeable of anything and kept using the phrase "I have no clue") things will get better!

I always like to address the positive first: Last night (sat not busy at all) The burgers were absolutely amazing.  however, here is why the 3 star rating --the wait staff were extremely slow to busy talking to other staff instead of serving customers .  We were sitted within 5 min,  it took the wait staff 20 minutes to ask us if we wanted anything to drink or if we were ready to order?  For a fast food Burger place it took an additional 40 min to get our burger. The burgers were amazing (thanksgiving day burger) the tots and fries not so much. The establishment is very small, the price is very expensive.  Two burgers two fries and two soft drinks 44.00 Cad. Fries are charged extra. Would I go back yes.. But take out less the fries, wait staff need to be spoken too

This is a solid burger joint. Sat barside and had no issues being seated immediately. The environment was exactly what was expected, busy, chatty, friendly and fun. TVs displayed local sports teams (Cleveland Indians) as well as a Wahlberg family mash up (Donnie killled the Dance off portion by the way) that was hilariously delightful. Food was delivered very promptly and taste was delicious. Only gave four stars because of price in comparison to other burger joints. Would definitely recommend visiting though!
Got my burger wrong...did not even apologize for that mistake. Rude server....Over priced been there done that won't go back EVER....

Horrible service!  They should fire the Manager who was working on Sunday afternoon Nov 13 2016.  I sat at the bar and order a drink and food - got the drink but no food!  30 minutes later I enquired and it was discovered my order was never entered into the system.  The problem is they are over staffed with employees more interested in talking to each rather than serving customers.  The Manager was oblivious and the kitchen consistently had 3-4 employees standing around talking.  Unless your flight is delayed - stay away until the get a decent manager who cares and they train their staff!

I've eaten here once before and had a great experience. But as I stand outside I wish I could give this restaurant lower than a one star. This "hostess" staff is the rudest individuals I've ever encountered in Vegas. The hostess was so rude she even spoke with her coworker talking crap...it was beyond unprofessional.

Been here 2x the last 2 days for the official opening days.  Food was outstanding and we didn't wait longer than 15min for food either time.  Team is fast and efficient even though they are learning to handle all the business.  I loved the "Our Burger" and my husband has had the "Donnie BBQ burger" the last 2 days. He loved it.  Onion rings are out of this world and so is the Smores Frappe with marshmallow vodka.  Either visit we were here, we did not have an issues with greasy food at all.

We each ordered a burger and they were good, but it all came out within 5 minutes which makes me believe that the food was not cooked fresh to order. We shared an order of fries, which had the potential to be good if they were hot and fresh out of the fryer, but they weren't. The major problem for me was the service - I've had better service at Applebee's. With most restaurants having great service on the Las Vegas strip, Wahlburgers really needs to step up their game.

Huge fan of the show and I was really lookin forward to trying this place out but it was nothing special. The burger didn't have much flavor and I asked for my fries to be extra crispy but they weren't. 

On top of it all, it was a lot more expensive than I expected. I don't see how they could charge people that much for the quality of food they serve. Don't see myself coming back here unfortunately. Good luck to Marky Mark though!

I enjoy the show but sadly I didn't enjoy the restaurant. We had a party of six and our server missed taking down half of our order probably do to the overly loud music playing in the background. The food we did receive took waaaaay to long and just really wasn't impressive. Because of that I feel they're overpriced. I did like the souvenir picture they took for purchase towards the end of our meal and bought it. I'm glad to have experienced wahlburgers but honestly will never go again.
Great flavor burger.... Wife absolutely loved the onion rings, and the service was good... Would go back.

Waiting over an hour for Burger and tater tots.
Don't go here unless you have a lot of time to waste

My boyfriend and I ate here while we were in Vegas and left feeling disappointed and kind of ripped off.

We stopped in to get a snack and saw that the Double Decker was described as "two 3 ounce burgers" and understood that to mean that we would get two burgers, each with a three ounce patty, and that we could split that. My boyfriend asked for "the two 3 ounce burgers" and we also ordered fries and the bacon mac and cheese.

What we got was two orders of the double decker, and by "two 3 ounce burgers" they actually mean two 3 ounce patties so we ended up with twice as much food as we meant to order. When we told our server, he didn't seem to understand the confusion and didn't offer a solution.

Along with what I feel is confusing menu language and a lack of customer service, the mac and cheese was watery and flavorless and the fries were average.

The burgers were actually really tasty but overall we didn't have a good experience here and won't be returning next time we're craving burgers in Vegas.

Came here on a Saturday afternoon and enjoyed the burgers. They weren't the BEST burgers we'd ever had, but they were still pretty decent (maybe we were just super hungry from walking around the Strip all day, haha). The staff & cashiers at the to-go station were friendly. The only thing we didn't like about this place was how small & crowded it gets. Also, this place doesn't have an actual customer restroom which was a little weird. And they could've sat people in the patio section but it was closed that afternoon for whatever reason. Our burgers & fries also came out pretty fast, so that was good. We would come back in the future.

Got their signature burger and it was meh. Bun was interesting and the sweet potato tots were a nice change from regular fries. It was soooo salty though - definitely have had better burgers for the same price.

Sorry Walburg family but someone need to QC this property 
Food was below average , service was horrible . I think you would be better off to send staff home instead of offering the most unfriendly service . These girls made Air Canada look good and that's a tough one
The food was absolutely disgusting, no taste. Everything was blend. The food was overpriced, the portion is small. This place is overrated, don't waste your money.

Vegas Baby!!!! Yeah, we stopped here after some major shopping at the outlets!  All the walking made us hungry for some meat!  We ordered The Melt......delicious, greasy, wonderful!!!! Added extra mushrooms.  We also tried the regular burger, fries and onion rings.  Fans of the fries, but would not reorder the onion rings.  Not what we were used to.  These are very lightly breaded red onion "strings".....We also ordered the Margaritas.....just average machine style frozen....low on the alcohol content.  We tried the pina colada...better than the Margarita...but not great.  Just go with a coke and drink alcohol elsewhere!  Otherwise....loved the Melt!!!!!

We were seated immediately. Our waiter was great. Made several good suggestions. One of which was the white Sangria. I was not disappointed. Walked into restaurant just after lunch rush. Restaurant was a little messy. I ordered the BBQ Bacon and a side of Mac and Cheese. Both were terrific. My husband ordered the Fiesta Burger and also was not disappointed. We will definitely go back when in the area again

They don't give 2 shits about handicapped. THERE IS NO PARKING IN FRONT OF THE RESTURANT FOR EITHER PICK UP OR HANDICAPPED. You litterally have to park at ballys. Drive around in ballys parking looking for a spot, go down to Ballys, walk through Ballys fighting the drunk crowd all the way, only to get lost...double back fighting the crowd again. Nope wrong exit...AGAIN! I gave up and went back to my car in agonizing pain from my bad leg. Thanks a phuqueing lot Walhburger.

Been wanting to try this new burger spot. Don't waste your time or money. Lets start with the atmosphere; bright, cartoonish and very spread out. Wait staff was friendly, but the host was clueless. Moving on tothe drinks, stick to beer or soft drinks. Terrible wine and cocktails, sent 3 back. The spiked cherry coke tasted like cough syrup and the strawberry something tasted like sour cotton candy. When taking our food order, the server recommended the burger be medium well. Hmm. Never heard that at a burger joint. Very small menu, could be a food truck. Food was just ok. Burgers lacked flavor. For 2 drinks, 2 burgers, tots and onion rings, the bill was $70. Don't mind paying for a good experience, this wasn't one. And btw, spent most of my night in the bathroom. Yuk!  Also notice that corporate only thanks good reviews, how 'bout a sorry for all the unhappy diners. Stick to the burger you know....

I was finally able to try whalburgers and it was  one of the bests I've had. Environment is clean and sleek. Atmosphere and service is friendly and upbeat. The place was busy , but our order was taken promptly. Food was delivered in a timely manner as well. Definitely worth the money.

Tried checking in thru Facebook but it couldn't locate it.   My daughter and I both had the Our Burger and split an order of Sweet Potato Tots.

It was okay.  My bun was a little soggy from the grease.  I really couldn't tell it had a special sauce on it.

Overall the food, service, etc. was fine.   It's not a place I'd specifically go back to eat but would if we were in the neighborhood and someone in the group wanted to go check it out.

My first time at Wahlburgers! I loved it! 
I had the Our Burger, it was cooked well and the flavours were awesome! Great prices for Las Vegas strip! I want to come back! Tomorrow!!

Thank you Wahlburgers!!!

My family and I came down to Las Vegas for Christmas and decided in making Wahlburgers our Christmas Eve dinner which turned out to be the best thing we could've done. The food was fantastic like out of this world phenomenal no joke but that truly wasn't the best thing about this place. The best thing about Wahlburgers is their server Ross. My God this man was exceptional. Since my husband is military we've been lucky enough to eat all over this world and this wonderful man is The BEST. I really hope management sees this and gives him the recognition he so rightfully deserves. Thank you Ross for making us so happy, you went beyond regular service.

Let me start with I sooooo wanted to be blown away by the food. 
The staff is plenty nice. But I must wonder why any restaurant would employ a vegan waitress in a restaurant that specializes in HAMBURGERS!?!
She was super nice but knew nothing about how the food was. 
The bacon Mac and cheese ... Cmon!!!! 8 bucks for this?!!!
We got the melt and the bbq bacon burger. Both were subpar ... I felt like the burgers at dang red robin are better. The fried onions are a upset stomach waiting to happen. The sweet potato tots are all right but ehhh... Won't be back!!

If you want a perfect, fresh burgers that doesn't remind you of chains, this is the place!  Picked the Our Burger and the flavors were amazing! Try the tater tots too!! Clean, efficient and great staff. All we needed was an actual Wahlburg and the night would have been complete!
Decent cheeseburger. Mine was well done, just like I ordered it. The bun was soft and warm. 15 minute wait, considering it was peek time on a Friday. Everything is a la carte. Tater tots are great

Sorry to say. But this place is not worth the time or the money. Kitchen entirely too slow and wait time for food 1 hour 45 minutes   Waited over 10 minutes for check. Burgers were just ok. I was just whelmed. Don't expect much here. I know everything is more expensive on the strip but this is rediculous. Also the place was way too loud and the manager Miguel also made racist comments that included saying"we need more Mexican cooks".  The only bright spot was our server Alex. She did her best to give decent service but her efforts were hampered by her other staff and kitchen help.

Great place to come to while you're in Vegas. I was really craving a burger and Wahlburgers really satisfied my hunger. The service was great. We were told that the wait on a table would be 20 minutes, but it turned out to actually be about less than 10. Being quite honest, my prime fascination for this place is because of Mark Wahlberg and also because there isn't a Wahlburgers in Texas yet. They had a good selection of drinks and a variety of burgers. I chose a regular beef patty burger and the patty was pretty thick and juicy. I would definitely visit this place again, especially if Wahlburgers comes to Texas.

We thought that based on the show the service would be great and the burgers good... Service was not what one would expect and the 18% gratuity for poor service is a joke!  We were 5 adults and one child so this was a group of six and told ofthe mandatory gratuity.  If you have this fee then service your clients to prove the tip is worth it!!

Burgers were good however, A bit greasy...
Long ticket time!
Menus were in very poor shape considering it recently opened... You don't see this mess on the show!!!  Go to the Toronto location... You will all agree!

I thought this place was better than the other reviews on Yelp. My wife wanted to go because she loved NKOTB and this will probably be the only time we will get to try it. I had the Our Burger with Bacon. It was really good. The lemonade was made from real lemons but was a little tart. I had to add a few packs of sugar. The price was reasonable for touristy Vegas. The wait staff was really nice and kept checking on us to make sure we were taken care of. I would go back again.

Two of our orders were wrong. My husband asked for a refill, they took his cup with a straw, when he got it back it lots of lipstick on it. We had to exchange for new one.  Then when the bill came we saw pop/coke was 1.99. We were charged $5.99 per drunk times 5. Really! We asked why they said because we got collector cups. Really we never asked for them. They said if you Don't wants them you need to let them know. Bad, bad business. So it cost us $24 for soda total rip off. Should have been $10. Las Vegas location.

Meh. 

Not at all what I expected (I don't really know WHAT I was expecting...) but I do like that they have dining with a BAR up front and your typical take away in back.

That's where the positives stop. The burger is dry with zero flavour. I'm all about showcasing the meat flavour in a good piece of beef but these aren't so go ahead and throw some s&p on that sucker.  

Really nice staff and the tots are top notch (but you can't really eff up tots so...)

We watch the show and are fans of Donny and Mark but dissapointed in food and service. They sat us at table where sun was beaming on us so we decided to eat outside. I ordered Mac n cheese the top of it was good the more I got to the center the drier it became. Hubby ordered dad burger which was nothing special. Won't be back.
The burgers are really good, but they are overpriced.  You can get a better burger for a lower price at many other locations.

I was very disappointed.

Not impressed with the decor. The prices, including the drink menu, were on the high end of average. The place seemed to want to have a home-y feel, but it just didn't. Plastic green chairs don't seem to work with $15 drinks- it just seemed gimmicky. Pictures of the Wahlburgs everywhere, obviously, and TVs playing clips from Mark's movies. I don't know what else I expected, but it seemed a little weird.

Food- the food actually was good. The burger, which was around $11, was fantastic! It didn't come with sides, which made it overpriced. The group I was with got tater tots and onion rings as sides. The tater tots were good, the onion "rings" were actually the kind of crispy onions that are supposed to go on a burger. Good, but hard to eat? 

The 2 stars were for the very good burger, the three missing are for the service. The server forgot both of our sides. She mentioned that they had just opened, which I totally understand, but her forgetting to put in half of what we ordered has nothing to do with them just opening. Their debit machine was down for a few minutes- THAT is 100% not her fault. Putting the order in was. Service was also slow, and we'd been finished for at least 15 minutes before anyone came to see if we were done, wanted a bill, etc.

Also, 18% service charge. Really? Someone below said that if you complain about 18% you shouldn't be eating there, but I disagree- it's the principle. I always try to tip decently well. (Management wise- I wonder if the servers SEE all of those tips.....) 

I would go again for take out only. Not to dine in. And even so, for the price, I'd probably end up elsewhere.

I was Sooooo looking forward to eating at Wahlburgers while visiting Vegas. Boy,,,,was I highly disappointed from the moment we arrived at the "Restaurant " the host at front door was less than inviting and even less helpful.  Once we FINALLY got to sit at the bar it took quit a while before one of the 5 people behind the bar to greet us let alone ask what we would like to drink.
It took equally as long to take our order of food. With great expectations we waited and waited to finall
y receive "Our Burger" /Sloppy Joe/ salad and forgotten tots. I couldn't help but be so sad and laugh at how ridiculous. Waitress was more concerned with chatting with the other 4 to 5 people behind the bar.  Prices are to high for what you get and even higher for food that is high school cafeteria level. 
I can not believe this is the standards the Wahlburgers want.....  I think the bothers need to come out here and straighten manage and staff out ASAP.
PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE make it right !!

After all the tv show hype, it was nice to experience Wahlbutgers past its Boston Homebase

The decor at the Post-security US departures is hip and modern , nice bulkheads with lettering with green themed seating and murals.  There are communal very wide tables seating up to 8 people each which is a
Nice touch, as is the "cheers" style round bar with great beers on tap and classic rock
Serving as the background soundtrack.  The take out kiosk was very greasy spoonish with what appeared to be prepackaged muffins in a clear display and a bunch of cliff bars... Meh... 

Now for the menu, I got excited about the OBF burger which is an 8oz grain fed beef patty for $11.95. Except... It only comes with "house made tomato jam, bacon, Swiss cheese & sautéed mushrooms".  Well I only wanted an 8oz patty with lettuce tomatoes pickles and red onions and they said they can't do that as "their cash register  system isn't set up for
Those extra ingredients".  

Well that makes no sense!  Take away the nice decor and This is a greasy spoon that is waaaaay overhyped from The family brand name's fame.  Modern or not, it didn't leave me the best of impressions especially for something this simple as ordering what I wanted on their 8oz party which only goes with the OFD; keep your OFD I want to make my own when the ingredients were not what I wanted!  Locally, Hero burger and others offer a flame broiled propose burger with healthy ingredients and sides along with a price point that may be high but comeasurates with the overall experience, not this tv show hyped grease hole!

In the age of Chipotle style "have it your way"; $11.95 for a mediocre burger that is super extra greasy (the meat was fatty and the bun was bathing in the buttery spread it was smothered in) is not acceptable, airport or not!

Wahlbutgers is not worth the hype and the price for the experience and all the grease it oozes ... Next!

The food was not bad at all. I ate a burger with no meat (I did not want to pay the crazy $20 for a veggie burger. 

The fries were done well , not greasy and lightly done and fluffy inside.  

No complaints , about the food , only thing $65 for 3 Our burgers , fries,  a Coke,  Soda water and coffee was a little much for me (considering I did not have meat ). 

I know it is  the strip , but for locals like us it is kind of a detour , having to pay tourist price .

You get to keep the cups and if you can eat in under and hour , the parking is free.

Walked in around 4pm was greated right away. Our waitress was very nice. Swensons is still the best burger in Northeast Ohio but this was #2 in my adventures. The onion rings were unreal good and it was huge you won't find rings better. The tots were tots nothing fantastic. I got the double bacon cheese burger and it was cooked perfect to how I wanted it. Will be back hopefully we get one on the west side

Service was great--- sat at the bar-bartender was pleasant/friendly and helpful. Food arrived timely. Cocktails were delicious. Our burgers were soo fresh and good and the special sauce is yummy!!! A fun vibe as soon as you walk in. Would recommend to anyone who is in Toronto and it's in a great location! Will def come back when I'm back in Toronto.

Wahlburgers on the Strip!!! Wow what a great burger! Simple yet tasty, light yet bursting with flavor and way cheaper than many competitors on the strip. My Husband and I went to a more expensive celebrity chef restaurant in Planet Hollywood known for its burgers and Wahlburgers blew them away, no competition. We had the Our Burger and thin crispy onion rings. If you sit at the bar you'll be delighted by the bar manager Emma with the greatest customer service.

Seriously the best burger I've ever had!!! I'm a fan of Paul's work ethic and passion for what he does, my boyfriend and I were going to do a seafood buffet but took a taxi to Ballys instead just to try Wahlburgers.  The staff was amazing, the best service I've yet to receive at a restaurant that didn't cost me 300 bucks.  Sat down and was served waters in a to go cup which was an awesome touch, my boyfriends Guinness was poured perfect, cascading down the cup as we decided what to eat.  Best freaking fries I've ever had!!! Onion rings were the string type which our server came out with two Wahl sauces and forks on his own, prime touch! We got the regular Wahlburger which is Paul's favorite, didn't add a thing to it and stoked we didnt.  I got the Wahlbrewski from a local brewer and loved it.  They come around and ask if you want a picture (free) they come later with no pressure to buy and give you a free postcard to keep.  Not gonna lie it was worth the cab fare and small wait time. I wouldn't take time to write if I didn't feel so passionately about it.  My first yelp review.  It's worth the hype!  Good job guys on pushing your brothers food to the world!  Well done to management for pushing your staff to be the best!!! Please keep it up!!! I'll be back for sure!!!

Big fan of the show Wahlburgers, and was hoping that my travels would take me to a place that would have a restaurant.  Wahlburgers is located near Bally's in the Grand Bazaar.  Literally right outside Bally's if you are staying there.  They have indoor and patio seating, and it was a nice enough early evening that it was fine to sit outside.  After a review of the menu, I chose Donnie's Favorite, which is the BBQ Bacon burger (minus the jalapenos).  When I got my order, I have to admit that it was a juicy, flavorful burger.  Just the right size for me in terms of portion.  As a side, I ordered the tater tots, since that's what they talk about on the show all the time.  Good tots, but nothing spectacular.  I should have probably adventured to try the sweet potato tots instead.  If you want some souvenir swag, there's a booth closer to the street that sells hats, shirts, etc.  If I was in Vegas longer, I would have considered going to Wahlburgers again!

Sat here to have a few drinks before an international flight. The weight staff here seems unorganized and kind of unprofessional. Our waitress was eating food from home on her break at a table right next to us...we waited for ten minutes for another waitress to fill my wine. Okay to sit and wait for your flight especially since at options are limited at the end of Gate F (Terminal 1). Wish the service was a bit more on point.

Worst experience ever, was there last week, waited 40 minutes for food, waitress forgot our order, no apology. I'm not sure how they got our credit card because we never got the chance to buy anything. They charged us $4.27, not happy that I had to cancel my credit card.

Great food and service, good atmosphere, consistent design. Decent food pricing for downtown toronto although simple carbonated beverages have a 250% markup!

My only real complaint would be that its overly dedicated to Actor Mark Wahlberg. His face and "accomplishments" are plastered all over the place. Comes off as a bit arrogant, but hey when you're Mark, I guess you could whatever you please, heh.

Would def visit again to try the other menu items! Recommend.

Went for the first time. Was seated quickly even though the restaurant was busy. Ordered the burger and fries and they were fantastic. The burgers were very juicy, cooked perfectly and the sea salt fries were tasty. Our server Sophie was fast and friendly. The only problem I have was the portion size. The amount of fries you get is about avg with anywhere else however I found the burgers to be rather small and was left hunger after the meal.

Didn't even get a table because the hosts bumped our party of 6 down on wait list after patiently waiting for 30-45 mins. Hosts then had the audacity to tell us we  had to wait another 30 minutes....no thank you we'll go try Ramsey's burgers down the street. Service is King people!
Yummy but pricey. One double decker burger, one BBQ bacon burger, two sodas, one order of fries and one order of onion rings was $50.

Honestly, this place is awful. They are lucky they get the media via the tv show because if they had to rely on the food they'd be out of business. 

Burger was dry, overcooked, and so tiny, all you tasted was the dry bread, not a good thing. The tater tots were so awful tasting, I told the waitress and she apologized and took them off of my bill. The tomato slice was almost as big as my burger and it wasn't thick. Which I suppose is a blessing in disguise, since it was dry as anything and hard to chew and swallow. I ate about half of it because I was hungry, but this was really one of the worst burgers I've ever head. 

The staff was very nice and gracious and even apologized for the fact they refuse to cook the burger less than a very dry medium well.

Bleh. Don't eat here, even a fast food sandwich would be better.

This is my favorite place to get burgers!! I love the Portobello mushroom burger, and the regular burger is amazing. I came here in the afternoon and was surprised at how many seats there were. I was expecting small areas to sit, and not having any room. There was plenty of space to walk around, and the seats were super comfy. I really enjoyed the amazing, hard-working staff. They were super helpful and sweet. My most recomended dish at this fine place would be the onion rings. They don't look normal, but the taste is extrodinary.

Nice new addition to my building!  As the second to review, I'd say the first review was a clear case of "hating". Anyone having difficulty with an 18% tip probably should be dining at McDonalds.  I had their "Our Burger" and it was perfectly cooked, delicious taste.  Had fries on the side which are shoestring fries.  The fries and the onion rings which should be called onion strings do not come out looking like most people are used to.  However, the taste of both of them are quite good.

No question that the place is more expensive than your average burger joint, but is this really surprising?  You are going to pay $15-20 for a combo at the Priest or 5 guys as well.  In terms of the burgers, The Priest is still better but the feel and decor of Wahlburgers is far and above the competition.  I'd recommend getting the sample sliders so you can sample the different burgers.  Definitely would go back!

Wonderful experience at the Toronto Airport.  Delicious juicy burgers and fries.  Great selection of local beers.  This was a real find and the Manager, Herman made sure that all the food for my daughter was peanut free.  The service from Wendy was outstanding--A great find!

As a foodie, I like to try new places when I'm on vacation.  With a recommendation from my neighbor, he gave high praises and said that we have to go to Wahlburgers while we're in Vegas.

I'm a little shy about trying a celebrity joint because it can be "overrated" however I will give it a try when it's recommended by a friend.  

There was a short line, hostess said our wait will be 20 minutes or a table for 3.  Well, we got a text within 5 minutes saying our table was ready.  That was quick.

The menu is pretty basic, burgers, fries, tots, pasta and salad.  They have items that they co-created with other celebrities like P-Diddy (Aqua Hydrate).  I ordered that and it taste like water!

We all ordered the same burger - The "Our Burger" with the fixings that we wanted and we all agreed that it was really good and exceeded our expectation.  Hubby ordered regulars fries and he said it was ok, I got the tots extra crispy and I liked it, our friend onion strings and she really liked it but it taste better when it first comes out hot.  

Your burger is cooked to order so sit there and have a good ole' conversation with your peeps and make some memories with selfies while you are there waiting for your food.

I liked that the fountain drinks came with a take home cup with free refills.  They also have desserts but we were stuffed to sample any.

I love burgers and it was cooked perfectly and I normally stay off the strip.  Next visit I will Uber it again to this spot!

You would think I order a burger called the melt with cheese and it would be on a nice burger bun. Instead it's a patty on stale toast and it just sucks. What a let down. Was looking forward to going here to have a burger for a week! A comment from the waitress that's it's not technically a burger would have helped.

Twice I have been to the restaurant.  The first time I ordered Jenny's chicken burger and the second time I ordered the portobello mushroom burger.  Both times I was very pleased with not only the food but the service.  I can't wait to go back!

When I heard we were getting another burger place in the North Hills I thought we already have enough, so if another one opens it needs to be pretty great.  Unfortunately after trying Walhburgers I feel like they are banking on their celebrity status as the food is just lackluster and overpriced.

I had the Fiesta Burger for dinner with Smoked Bacon Mac'n cheese on the side.  The Mac'n cheese was the star of this meal.  It was delicious, but came in a very small cup so was a bit disappointing.  I expected the side to be a bit bigger, maybe even sharable since some of the other sides came in baskets.  The Fiesta Burger was not a fiesta in my mouth, I expected more flavor and spice.  

I honestly wanted to like this place, but left me returning to my usual burger spots.  I wouldn't turn down a cup of that Mac'n cheese though don't even ask me to share it.

I watch the show so I had to try it out. Paul Wahlberg does have a lot to worry about. When you have an absentee owner you do lose a lot of what made you successful in the first place. When the place is about burgers and the chili was the best part you may have to rethink the menu. I really wanted to try Alma's American chop suey but not on menu. Dang! Sorry but this is an over priced Wendy's burgers.

This place is pretty good. I ended up coming in here on my own so needed a table for one. They have the convenience of being able to order in and not have wait service. You can also do take-out or come in for full-service restaurant.  A burger and fry cost me $15 with tax. Food was good and the portion sizes were  fair but bordered on small. Seats are comfortable and spacious. bright atmosphere. The waitstaff did not appear too overly enjoy their job. I was greeted at the front door and given instructions on how to proceed. That was good although I was not made to feel overly welcome as if they were excited to see a customer walk to the door. I would come back for sure but would not rush to recommend.

Burger spot. No just kidding, it's a burger spot. But it is well known. Good thing is there are some good burgers here. The sizes of the burgers are perfect. My wife and I ate at the exterior bar. This is why they are receiving 3 stars. It was hot the day we went and over the bar there aren't any fans. I can't knock whoever built the place, because they may not have known that the area in downtown isn't the most windy. They're on Ontario, prospect is basically the wind tunnel. 

The interior is bright. The indoor bar is large with plenty of tables to seat plenty of hungry individuals. The wait time when we went was no existent. Around the interior there are plenty of posters, all wahlburg branded of course. Movie posters for Mark, you know. It's right under the jack so you can either enter or exit right from an elevator straight from the jack.

With that out of the way, let's speak on service and food. Our bartender was delightful. She understood the heat and gave us water without us even saying anything. She was thorough and attentive. Walburgers has a simple menu, not too large or small. This is a good thing. The negative is that fries are not a standard side. They make up by having large sides that you purchase separately that can be shared between two people. That's what my wife and I did. We ordered our 2 burgers and split their crispy onion rings, which were a HUGE helping for the price. Speaking on the onion "rings" they weren't rings, they were more like crispy shreds. They breading on them was delicious though. I'd never thought I'd like onion shreds outside of a burger but they were definitely done right. This is once again where the bartender came in and helped, we both ordered the onion rings, she quickly told us that we'd definitely only need one serving as it ended up being a large basket. I'd even say 3 people could share them if they get larger burgers. 

As for the burgers themselves. They're definitely flavorful. I ordered the double decker. Which is a classic burger, the veggies were crisp and fresh, the bun was delicious. I haven't seen others reviews or why wahlburgers is getting a bad rap unless it's because of the outdoor bar. The food is good , I've had better burgers elsewhere, but these burgers definitely lived up to the hype.

Wow.  Service was rough.  Took a very long time to get an order loaded for soda and then another wait to get a food order in.   Atmosphere was loud, floor was sticky and area was cramped.   The food was good, but not a place I was impressed.   Probably not a place I would try again.

This place is SO good!!! Literally ate here twice during my 3 day vegas trip. 
You have to try the thanksgiving sandwich, it is bomb! My only complaint is......WHY DONT YOU HAVE A LOCATION IN SAN DIEGO!!!!
I normally don't write reviews , but let me tell you I ordered the BBQ bacon burger and it was amazing! My husband got the beast then ordered one to go. Amazing! Ps you have to try the onion rings.

Wow want an out standing burger that's not the typical in n out come here! The ambiance is casual, which I find more enjoyable on a late night dinner outing. The service was friendly and very prompt. They explained how everything was just how "momma" made it. I ordered the ofb I think it was called and it sent my taste buds on a wonderful ride. Next time your looking for something open late and delicious come here.

Okay, I should have posted this along time ago, but I've been really busy moving to another state, I just happen to stop by to see some family/friends in Cleveland.  
        I was expecting better.  Service took too long and ended up with okay burgers, I've had way better burgers. The place wasn't even packed.  We came here around 6pm. They put us outside and there was a lot of big mosquitoes.  It felt like we came during a shift change or something, or just simply came at the wrong time.  We could tell the manager noticed we were waiting for a long time, walked by us and looked our way but didn't say anything.  We came in a group of 10. I don't think I'll be coming back.  Sorry Wahlbergs.

After reading the other reviews, it seems this place is getting stars for food, but dinged for service.  After  having lunch here, I think they must be talking about some other restaurant.

Came in on a Wednesday just before noon.  Tribe game tonight, so no unusual crowds.  Was immediately seated and treated by a waiter who brought me an ice water with a lemon.  

After seeing me struggling with what burger I wanted, he made some recommendations, one of which was the BBQ bacon burger I had my eye on.  Ordered it with sweet potato tots (looked good in the Yelp pictures, otherwise I never would have ordered them).

After a few minutes, another server came up on one side of my 2 man table and replaced my water with another, with lemon, without me asking.  While I was distracted by this beverage swap out, another server banged the container of tots on the table and set my burger in front of me.  The guy didn't say a word, just dropped the food on the table, turned tail and ran.   Actually startled me!  

With the one exception of 'lack of social skills server man', the overall service was crazy fast.  I think I waited all of 5 minutes from the time I walked in the door to the time I was eating.

Regarding the food, the burger was nicely prepared, toppings were good, but it was way too much bun.  The sweet potato tots, which again I never would have ordered as I'm not a fan of sweet potatoes, were very good.  I did find it a bit odd that I never got silverware, but that seems to be their MO, as it wasn't needed for what I was eating.  

After I was done, I asked my waiter for a side of pickles, as I saw on the menu they were homemade.  He brought me a cup with my check, and I was a bit surprised to find them more like sweet pickles than dill, but good nonetheless.  

I was in and out in 20 minutes, including the time to write this review.  A lesser bun or a bigger burger with this service would have gotten 5 stars.

UPDATE!  After about 15 minutes of leaving the store, my belly began doing flips and my bowels started screaming for relief.  Found a gas station along the road and almost shit my pants waiting for the guy in front of me to finish his business.  Then, I see there is no TP in the stall, so I have to waddle butt cheeks clenched to the women's can and grab some TP.  Return to the mens's room and experience the most explosive diarrhea I've experienced in a long, long time.  I have an iron gut that no normal food can annihilate, but something went horribly wrong here.  Not sure if it was the lemon, pickles, tots, burger or maybe the guac, but this review just went from a 4/5 to a 1.
Was excited to try Wahlburgers.  Poutine was just average but ok.  The burger had no taste and was quite dry.  I would not spend the money to eat here again
We have been waiting to try this place since last summer! It was epic!!! The Thanksgiving sandwich was awesome!! Our server  Victor was awesome and friendly!!! We will be back!

The burger didn't leave me feeling gross after eating it, however I didn't enjoy it. The meat was under seasoned. My server claimed she didn't hear the first order (of the burger). That was forgiven. But then blamed the kitchen for not bringing out a float I ordered. Sad face. The fries were good.

Like a lot of others I really wanted to like this place. Who doesn't love a good burger? There was a small wait when we arrived but the bar was open so we sat there instead. They restraunt layout is strange, you are greeted at the door by someone taking your name but they never mentioned the bar option but we asked and we're alowed through. The place doesn't advertise but they also have take out. 
Our server was great and the food came out quick. I ordered the bbq burger and my husband the thanksgiving sandwich. He loved his but mine was just ok. There wasn't much sauce so I asked for more bbq sauce. It was horrible. Way too much cumin and if you have ever had too much cumin it tastes like b.o. The house made ranch was bad too. The burger was ok but a little dry. 
I just expected more but was sadly let down.
The Our Burger was Ok. I didn't really get a good flavor. Not impressed with the bun. The pasta salad was one of the best I've ever eaten. But,  I went there for a good burger.

Not a bad spot to grab lunch.  It was hot out but the wife and I were HANGIN TOUGH. Walburgers definitely had the RIGHT STUFF.  There was even a friendly lady walking around, CLICK CLICK CLICK, taking complimentary photos.  Our COVER GIRL, Amber, was super nice. She offered suggestions and always had a smile on her face.  Well lit, definitely DON'T TURN OUT THE LIGHTS NOW, clean, and ample seating....probably even at 2 IN THE MORNING.  In the SUMMERTIME or winter, whether you're SINGLE or with the one you tell I'll BE LOVING YOU FOREVER Wahlburgers deserves a visit. This occasion only, BE A BLOCKHEAD and stop on in!!!

A huge hamburger fan as well as Wahlburg fan.. was so excited to visit the new restaurant that opened in the North Hills area of Pittsburgh.   They do not accept reservations so my first trip was on a week day  - hoping to beat the crowd.  It wasn't as bad as I expected.   The area where the restaurant is - the mall has completely been revamped... and guessing this restaurant was opened here to attract more businesses to the local stores/area.  I just found it odd of all places for Walburgs is in the North Hills - not downtown or southside etc.  BUT!!!!  I am all for more jobs and do like to see other areas of the Burg thrive.  There is a small bar (about 10 bar stools) you can grab a drink or eat at.  The dining room consists of tables mostly - only a few booths.   I thought it would be bigger in size but it was just right. There is also an outside balcony with outside seating.  So we only had to wait about 15 minutes for a table (Thursday 5 pm).
